description: On January 21, Hubei announced that health administrative departments at all levels should strengthen the management, guidance, supervision and inspection of epidemic reports. Those who report, conceal, omission or make false reports shall be investigated for the responsibilities of relevant units and individuals in accordance with the law.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 25 January 2020. Inner Mongolia Government announces that, under the first-level response to public health emergencies,

- All regions must collect, evaluate, report, and release COVID-19 information every day in a timely, proactive, and accurate manner.

- According to the epidemic, banner or county level governments may declare the scope of the outbreak within their region upon the decision of the next higher level government.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered that close attention must be paid to the public opinion in property service areas. False rumors and unconfirmed information should be promptly stopped and correctly guided to avoid causing panic among property owners.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: China's Hunan province decides to correctly guide public opinion and prevent all kinds of rumors and false propaganda, on Jan 26 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 27 January 2020, the provincial government of Guangdong clarified that severe quarantine measures will not be adopted in the province but that some traffic control measures will be put into place. This is in response to rumors that big cities like Guangzhou and Shenzhen will implement a total lockdown, which have already affected people in Guangzhou by inducing some to rush to supermarkets to stockpile foods and necessary goods. In order to combat disinformation, the government also announced that it will be holding a daily press conference to update the virus situation and is calling for residents not to believe rumors starting on 27 January 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that all colleges and universities must use campus networks, Weibo, Wechat public accounts, teacher group chats, student group chats, parent group chats, etc., through announcements, warm reminders, a letter to teachers and students, etc., to educate and guide teachers, students, and parents not to believe or spread rumors.

description: On February 1, 2020, Alxa League Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that Alxa League would strictly enforce the law, severely crack down on the behaviour of misreporting the epidemic, fabricating and disseminating false information and rumours about the COVID-19.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: China, on 04 Feb 2020, Guangdong provincial government posted its requirement regarding pandemic disinformation. When a residential area or its surrounding area discovers an infected person, the local residential management should aid the county residential committee to help to alert the nearby residents, inform them of the next step quarantine guidelines. The local residential reporting must be based on truthful, reliable, identifiable, and verifiable sources or facts. The local residential management team must not fabricate information or transmit false information.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: After February 6, 2020, Zhejiang government in China is enforcing some anti-discrimination measures in rural areas to timely stop the dissemination of unconfirmed speeches, information on undiagnosed suspected cases, and personal information such as IDs, home addresses, mobile phone numbers, etc of quarantined people.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On Feburary 28 2020, The Center for Disease Control and Prevention of Chengdong District in Xining City reported that a story being spread on WeChat about two confirmed symptomatic cases of COVID-19 was false. The story originated from a misunderstanding of leaked internal communications in the local health department, and the two suspected cases in question tested negative. The relevant staff will be punished according to regulations.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: In Xinjiang, from Jul. 25 onwards, if someone spreads rumours about epidemic situations, false police information, or intentionally disrupt public order during the epidemic period according to Article 25 of the Law on Public Security Administration Punishments, he/she has to detain for more than 5 days and less than 10 days, a fine of less than 500 yuan will be concurrently imposed. If the circumstances are minor, there will be detention for less than 5 days or a fine of less than 500 yuan.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 28 January 2020. Education Department of Inner Mongolia announces that until further notice:

1. Schools (all types and levels, private and public) will be closed and will delay reopening. Arranging make-up classes for third-year students of middle and high schools are forbidden. Students are not allowed to return to school.

2. All local educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning are to:
(a) make plans for the delay and adjust teaching plans (online, at-home learning),
(b) promote knowledge of infection prevention and control to students and parents via social media,
(c) implement measures required by the health department, set up protective isolation areas and conduct body temperature checks on campus, and
(d) immediately notify the schools, teachers, and students of the above requirements, enhance supervision, and set up reporting hotlines. Relevant persons will be held accountable for any violations.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 28 January 2020. Education Department of Inner Mongolia announces that until further notice:

1. Schools (all types and levels, private and public) will be closed and will delay reopening. Arranging make-up classes for third-year students of middle and high schools are forbidden. Students are not allowed to return to school.

2. All local educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning are to:
(a) make plans for the delay and adjust teaching plans (online, at-home learning),
(b) promote knowledge of infection prevention and control to students and parents via social media,
(c) implement measures required by the health department, set up protective isolation areas and conduct body temperature checks on campus, and
(d) immediately notify the schools, teachers, and students of the above requirements, enhance supervision, and set up reporting hotlines. Relevant persons will be held accountable for any violations.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 28 January 2020. Education Department of Inner Mongolia announces that until further notice:

1. Schools (all types and levels, private and public) will be closed and will delay reopening. Arranging make-up classes for third-year students of middle and high schools are forbidden. Students are not allowed to return to school.

2. All local educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning are to:

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that during the prevention and control period, schools at all levels and types must not open in advance, and students who returned home during the Spring Festival should not return to school in advance without notice. 
Except for the need for epidemic prevention and control, the schools should not arrange staff and teachers for business trips or visits.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that all colleges and universities shall implement fully closed management of campuses before the official opening of the spring semester and strictly control the entry and exit of outsiders. For personnel and vehicles that needed to enter or exit the campus due to prevention and control work and other special reasons, the schools must register them one by one and conduct temperature checks on the relevant personnel. If their temperature exceeds 37.3℃, the schools must resolutely discourage them from entering and leaving and guide them to seek medical treatment in time. Except for the work and life necessities of teachers and students in universities, classrooms, laboratories, sports venues, libraries, and other public places on campus would be closed temporarily. The schools must study in advance campus prevention and control work plans for after the beginning of school.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

We will encourage qualified primary and secondary schools to use the model of "Internet + teaching" to carry out distance education teaching activities or set up online learning courses.“

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Department of Education of Hubei ordered the Department of Education of all levels in the province to, according to the teaching scale and conditions within their jurisdiction, coordinate comprehensively all forces, integrate and mobilize educational resources, and carry out online teaching, independent learning, and online guidance and question-answering through the Internet, TV, mobiles, etc., and strive to ensure that all primary and secondary schools (including secondary vocational schools) postponed the start of school and kept teaching, while students postponed going to school and kept studying. The departments should not organize gathered learning and training, and should minimize personnel flow and contact as much as possible, conducting work on the premise of ensuring the safety of teachers and students.
The departments should do proper overall planning of the amount of resources and time used in each subject, appropriately reduce the content, slow down the progress, and ensure the content being standard, not increasing the burden on students, teachers and parents. The departments should attach great importance to guiding students to protect their eyesight, control the duration of online learning units, enrich teaching content and forms, and strengthen physical exercise guidance.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Full remote distance learning,Special provisions exist for how teaching is done which applies to all teachers,Special provisions for all students in a school (e.g. students in primary school do not have to social distance)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Education,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

Schools of all levels and types are not allowed to start school ahead of schedule without prior notice from the Gansu Provincial Department of Education.

description:
On January 30, 2020, Hubei Provincial Department of Education announced that all colleges and universities should study and form an overall organizational plan of emergency teaching for delayed start of school based on teaching tasks, resource construction, and infrastructure conditions. The schools should guide each department and major to plan for specific implementation, and require them to report. The schools should report to Department of Education before February 9, 2020.

The schools should stop organizing students to attend experiments, internship, training, and other practices at school, in residence, or out of town. The schools should coordinate with the internship training bases to postpone student internships and training. For students who had been doing internships out of town and cannot be withdrawn at the moment, the schools must coordinate with their internship units to protect teachers and students, and arrange special personnel to strengthen their daily management and preventive education. The schools should postpone registration for higher vocational students enrolled, higher vocational single recruits, and skill operation exams.

The main lecturers shall adjust syllabus and notify the class and all students. Student counselors and class teachers should actively assist the main lecturers to build a WeChat or QQ group chat for teaching.

The schools should establish a daily report system for students leaving school and manage learning conditions of students.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
institution_status: Higher education institutions allowed to open with conditions

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On Feb 16th, Heilongjiang Province in China published a policy with respect to closure and regulation of schools, which shut down all primary and secondary schools but ask them to still provide online study services, lasting for four weeks. description:
The department of education of Henan, China issued policies regarding to reopening the schools on Mar 9. 
Schools must strictly control the number of entrances and exits. Usually only one gate is allowed to open per campus, subject to change (open more during peak hours to avoid gatherings).
All faculty, staff and students who enter the campus should show health certificates and conduct temperature tests. Schools must be equipped with necessary temperature detection equipment (set up thermal temperature scanners at entrance if possible).
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Types of people on school premises are limited (e.g. no parents) ,Special provisions for all students in a school (e.g. students in primary school do not have to social distance)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the following: 

1(b) Staggered start for other grades of junior and senior high schools, secondary vocational schools, primary schools, kindergartens, and special education schools. 

1(c) Colleges and universities to resume classes in accordance with the unified arrangements of the Ministry of Education;

1(d) Schools will be notified in phases by the autonomous region of the start date for each grade. Arranging for re-opening without receiving notice remains prohibited. All educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning to provide official written reports to the education department a week before the re-opening regarding their arrangements.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the following: 

1(b) Staggered start for other grades of junior and senior high schools, secondary vocational schools, primary schools, kindergartens, and special education schools. 
1(c) Colleges and universities to resume classes in accordance with the unified arrangements of the Ministry of Education;
1(d) Schools will be notified in phases by the autonomous region of the start date for each grade. Arranging for re-opening without receiving notice remains prohibited. All educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning to provide official written reports to the education department a week before the re-opening regarding their arrangements. UPDATE: Policy ends on 20 April 2020 after the Education Department of Inner Mongolia has made an announcement on 21 April 2020, providing a further update on school re-opening.

China, Inner Mongolia; 29 January 2020. General Office of Inner Mongolia announces that:

1. Registration and commencement of admission examinations to art/discipline-specific institutions of higher learning will be postponed until further notice.

2. All training institutions (vocational, extracurricular, early childhood education, child care) are not allowed to initiate training activities without approval. Year 12 students could return to schools since April 1st and the return-school decision should be made by the provincial government. Year 9 students could return since April 7th and the return-school decision should be made by the municipal governments. Students of the other years could return to schools year by year separately, based on the severity of pandemic, after year 9 and year 12 fully returned.

4. description:
Starting May 07, 2020, the Chinese national government released new guidelines for the reopening of primary and secondary schools: 

1) Document all returning staff and student and check temperature at school entrance. 
2) Must conduct 14 days of self-quarantine before returning 
3) Daily health monitoring during morning and nights. Must report data daily to local government 
4) Health monitoring/reporting of families of staff and students 
5) Surveillance of health risks on campus. Daily sterilization of public areas, hand-washing and drinking services, and trash collection.
6) Control population density on campus, maintain social distancing protocols. Different school start times, lunch times, and end times should vary to prevent mass gatherings.
7) Restriction on all mass gatherings such as conferences, meetings. 
8) Strengthen COVID-19 education for returning students and staff
9) Encourage collaboration and communication with parents. 
10) Open psychological counseling, mental health related services, hotlines. 
11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Types of people on school premises are limited (e.g. no parents),Regular cleaning and sanitary procedures applied to classrooms (e.g. classrooms must be aired out after each class),School event cancelled or postponed,Temperature Check,Health Questionnaire
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: China, Inner Mongolia; 30 December 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several measures required to be implemented during the New Year and Spring Festival. Measures include requiring all schools to ensure that the classrooms, libraries, reading rooms, canteens, dormitories, bathrooms etc., are cleaned, disinfected, and aired daily. The schools should also organise infection prevention and control education for teachers and students, promoting good hygiene and encouraging them to wear a face mask while travelling to and from the campus.

description: The Tianjin City Education Administration has determined that the winter break will be from January 25, 2021, to February 22, 2021, lasting for 4 weeks. As per the guidelines, teachers, students, and staff are advised to minimize unnecessary outings. As a rule, they should not leave Tianjin, their place of residence, or exit the country unless absolutely necessary. If there is a need to leave their place of residence, they are required to report to the school.

description: On May 16th, 2021, it is announced that in Bayuquan District, Yingkou City, Liaoning Province, 10th and 11th grades in high school, middle school, and elementary schools were closed and classes were stopped, and online teaching was carried out. School closing management was implemented in the third grade of high school. This is due to a resurgence of cases in Liaoning Province on May 15th, 2021.

institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer City, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that starting from 15 July, in addition to continuing the current infection prevention and control measures and checking the health code and travel history code, all schools should check the proof of vaccination of those entering the campus. They are also required to register the details of those who are not vaccinated, recording information such as their name, ID number, occupation, residential address, phone number etc. They should then immediately report to the Education Department, which should report hereafter to the medical team of the local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Proof of COVID-19 vaccination,Temperature Check,Health Certificate
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Education,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On August 28 2021, the Jiangsu Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued a personal protection guide for the opening of schools,  asking not going out of the city and not going to medium and high-risk areas unless necessary. 

So far, Wuxi, Suzhou, Changzhou, Xuzhou, Lianyungang, Yancheng, Zhenjiang and Taizhou have returned to school normally on September 1  2021; Huai'an organized online learning guidance on September 1, 2021, and organized students to return to school in stages and batches from September 7, 2021; Suqian began to organize online teaching and learning guidance on September 1, 2021 and organized students to return to school in three batches from September 4, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with no conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The Covid-19 vaccine roll-out launched on 15 December 2020. As of 21th February 2020, Nantong City has launched 84 COVID-19 vaccination units with more than 1,000 vaccinators. A total of 68,627 people were vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus with 106470 doses

Nantong City has further refined the scope of key populations, including “international and domestic traffic crews, drivers and passengers, customs border inspection personnel, imported product handling, processing and sales personnel, and quarantine workers”. As the top priority, this group of people should be prioritised, and then expanded to all key groups, striving to achieve "vaccine as many as possible"

China, Inner Mongolia; 19 December 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the start of the first phase of vaccination. The first phase involves vaccinating key populations, including

description:
Jilin Province is currently vaccinating the COVID-19 vaccine for five groups of people.
On January 17, new epidemic prevention and control work at a news conference, jilin province government workers in response to reporters' questions when the link is introduced, the current jilin province is the key crowd new conduct of vaccination, at present there are five kinds of new crown vaccine key crowd: one is involved in the import port of cold-chain items of a line of the customs, inspection and quarantine personnel, port loading and unloading, handling, transportation and other related personnel; Second, international and domestic transportation personnel; 3. Border port personnel who go abroad for work or study for business or private reasons and are at high risk of overseas epidemic diseases; Fourth, medical and health personnel; Fifth, the urban operation guarantee personnel (including government agencies, public security, armed police, fire, community workers, water, electricity, heating, coal, gas related personnel, and engaged in transportation, logistics, elderly care, sanitation, funeral, communications and other related personnel.
Jilin province carried out in accordance with the principle of voluntary and free COVID-19 vaccine rules, vaccination age should be between the ages of 18 and 59 without vaccination taboo.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hinggan League, Horqin Right Middle Banner; 12 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several vaccination policies.

1. All residents aged over 18 years old and with no contraindications to the COVID-19 vaccine, regardless of their household registration, must get their first vaccination at one of the 14 vaccination sites by 25 July.

2. People with specific conditions or contraindications will need to provide evidence, such as a diagnosis certificate and proof of hospitalisation, issued by a level two or above medical institution. The primary care physician at the vaccination site will need to verify the provided evidence and fill out the “Pre-Vaccination Health Consultation and Contraindication Checklist for COVID-19 Vaccine”.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer Prefecture, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces a vaccination policy. 

1. All residents aged over 18 years old and with no contraindications to the COVID-19 vaccine, regardless of their household registration, must get vaccinated at one of the 14 vaccination sites across the banner. Their second vaccination must be completed by 25 August. 

2. People with specific conditions or contraindications need to provide a diagnosis certificate, proof of hospitalisation etc., issued by a level two or above medical institution and gain verification from the primary care physician at the vaccination site.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hinggan League, Horqin Right Middle Banner; 12 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several vaccination policies.

1. All residents aged over 18 years old and with no contraindications to the COVID-19 vaccine, regardless of their household registration, must get their second vaccination at one of the 14 vaccination sites by 25 August.

2. People with specific conditions or contraindications will need to provide evidence, such as a diagnosis certificate and proof of hospitalisation, issued by a level two or above medical institution. The primary care physician at the vaccination site will need to verify the provided evidence and fill out the “Pre-Vaccination Health Consultation and Contraindication Checklist for COVID-19 Vaccine”.

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Hohhot Prefecture, Saihan District; 2 February 2020. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that all communities (villages) in the district will be placed under curfew starting today. People and vehicles are not allowed to enter the community (village) from 22:00 to 07:00 the following day. Several circumstances will be exempted (i.e. the designated family member for purchasing necessities; those who need medical treatment due to illnesses; and those who work in electricity supply, production and sale of medical supplies, supermarkets, pharmacies or industries of other necessities). Those who enter/exit the community/village due to exceptional circumstances must inform the manager-on-duty of their reason and undergo temperature checks and real-name registration.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries

description: Starting from January 30th 2020, in order to strengthen the temperature monitoring and medical inspections of entry and exit personnel, Lhasa Customs has reactivated the system of filling out health declaration cards for entry and exit personnel, recorded the travel history and dynamic flow of entry and exit personnel, and intensified medical inspections. Lhasa Customs has connected with relevant departments such as the Autonomous Region Health Commission, Civil Aviation Tibet Regional Bureau, Entry-Exit Border Checkpoints, Autonomous Region Port Office and other relevant departments to strengthen information sharing, strictly in accordance with the requirements of the joint prevention and control mechanism. If a suspect is found at the port, he will be prevented from traveling and transferred to relevant medical institutions for further diagnosis and treatment in accordance with the relevant management requirements of the "Border Health and Quarantine Law" on quarantine infectious diseases.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that personnel and vehicles entering and leaving the city must have passes of the national, provincial, and county (district) or above level, to pass through after strict inspection, verification, and filing. Freight vehicles carrying prescriptive epidemic prevention materials and life support materials can pass directly after inspection and filing. Medical personnel vehicles needed for epidemic prevention and control can pass with identification. Vehicles transporting patients can leave the city with the transfer (diagnosis) certificate, but relevant personnel are not allowed to return until the epidemic is over. On February 13, Xiantao announced that for cross-city transportation of livestock and poultry feed; veterinary drugs, vaccines, livestock, and poultry epidemic prevention products;  live pigs and their products; eggs;urgently need agricultural materials; fruits and vegetables that need to be listed urgently, vehicles (full or empty vehicles with no more than 2 passengers), shall be released after inspection, temperature measurement, disinfection, and registration. For the transportation of cross-city aquatic fry and rice eel and other adult fish, after having the vehicle transportation permit provided by the department of traffic transportation at the municipal epidemic prevention and control headquarters, the vehicle will be released quickly.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: All countries

Freight vehicles carrying prescriptive epidemic prevention materials and life support materials can pass directly after inspection and filing. Medical personnel vehicles needed for epidemic prevention and control can pass with identification. Vehicles transporting patients can leave the city with the transfer (diagnosis) certificate, but relevant personnel are not allowed to return until the epidemic is over. On February 13, Xiantao announced that for cross-city transportation of livestock and poultry feed; veterinary drugs, vaccines, livestock, and poultry epidemic prevention products;  live pigs and their products; eggs;urgently need agricultural materials; fruits and vegetables that need to be listed urgently, vehicles (full or empty vehicles with no more than 2 passengers), shall be released after inspection, temperature measurement, disinfection, and registration. For the transportation of cross-city aquatic fry and rice eel and other adult fish, after having the vehicle transportation permit provided by the department of traffic transportation at the municipal epidemic prevention and control headquarters, the vehicle will be released quickly.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 23 February 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the following: 

(1) For close contacts of confirmed and suspected cases who have undergone quarantine and health monitoring for more than one week, once they are issued a health certificate of release from isolation, they will no longer be required to undergo quarantine and health monitoring again.

(2) For those who have travelled to and/or from Hubei and undergone quarantine and health monitoring for more than one week, once they are issued a health certificate of release from isolation, they will no longer be required to undergo quarantine and health monitoring again.

(3) For people who have travelled to and/or from areas with severe outbreaks, once they have undergone quarantine (including self-quarantine at home), they will no longer be required to undergo quarantine again.

(4) For people who have travelled to and/or from provinces other than Hubei and areas with severe outbreaks, they will not be required to undergo quarantine.

(5) People coming to and leaving the region will not be required to undergo quarantine.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: From Jan 26, 2020, there will be internal border restrictions in Gansu Province, China, as interprovincial shuttles and charter tour buses as well as all wharf operations will be suspended in the whole province. description: On March 13, Xiantao, Hubei decided that those who leave Xiantao to go outside the province (except Beijing), with a certificate of acceptance by their destination workplace or community (village) where they live, shall apply for returning to work (return to hometown) to the headquarters of the town where they are located. With a Hubei “Health Code” (or Xiantao “Yimatong”) green code or a health certificate issued by the current headquarters of the town, under the premise of good health management and implementation of prevention and control measures, people shall adopt a "point-to-point, one-stop" measure to return to work accurately, safely, and orderly.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 13, Xiantao decided that those who need to return to Xiantao from outside the province, holding a "Health Code" or a health monitoring certificate, will be allowed to pass after inspection, registration, and temperature measurement at the control point.

description: On February 8, Xiantao, Hubei formulated the "Implementation Plan for the Return of People in Xiantao to Hubei and Wuhan for Work during the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Epidemic". According to the plan, people in Xiantao returning to Hubei and Wuhan for work need to hold the return certificate approved by the prevention and control headquarters of the destination county (city, district) and the return consent certificate issued by the epidemic prevention and control headquarters of the currently located town (street, field, park, district). For people leaving Xiantao that do not cooperate with the village (community) for registration and examination, isolation and observation; organize or participate in gathered dining, gathering activities, gambling, and other violation of relevant regulations on epidemic prevention and control, their return may not be approved. On March 13, Xiantao decided that those who leave Xiantao for other cities within the province should be allowed to pass with a Hubei “Health Code” (or Xiantao “Yimatong”) after inspection, registration, and temperature measurement at a control point.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Migrant workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 15 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that:

1. All travellers entering Inner Mongolia (i.e., all foreign and returning citizens, including those from Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan) must report to the destination community (Gacha Village) or unit in advance. They must provide truthful information during registration, including their identity, contact number, country of residence, returning date, mode of transport, travel history within the last 14 days, health status, the purpose of entry, etc. They must also fill in the “Information Registration Card” truthfully when entering the country.

2. All administrative institutions, employers, and the general public must report any inbound travellers who conceal their overseas travel history or fail to take quarantine measures by informing their residing community (Gacha Village) or calling 110.

3. Those who refuse to abide by the epidemic prevention and control measures will be investigated and held accountable by law.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 20, 2020,  the Department of Pandemic Prevention and Control of Liaoning Province announced that all people entering Liaoning directly from the Liaoning ports and entering Liaoning via ports of other provinces (autonomous regions and municipalities), whether they are foreign or Chinese citizens, shall be treated equally with strict implementations of health declaration, temperature measurement, nucleic acid testing, and 14-day quarantine.
On March 20 2020 Liaoning Province announced the measures of preventing the import of overseas epidemics:  1. On March 20, 2020,  the Department of Pandemic Prevention and Control of Liaoning Province announced that all people entering Liaoning directly from the Liaoning ports and entering Liaoning via ports of other provinces (autonomous regions and municipalities), whether they are foreign or Chinese citizens, shall be treated equally with strict implementations of health declaration, temperature measurement, nucleic acid testing, and 14-day quarantine. For people entering China from the Liaoning port, people judged as the “four categories of personnel”, including confirmed patients, suspected patients, fever patients who cannot be ruled out of infection, and close contacts of confirmed patients, shall be centralised transported, quarantined, observed, and other measures of prevention and control; people with abnormal symptoms such as fever and cough shall be arranged by the port’s local government for transfer to a hospital.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On the 20th March,2020. According to a notice jointly issued on Thursday by five government departments, including the Civil Aviation Administration and the General Administration of Customs, Beijing will redirect some inbound flights scheduled to land at its Beijing Capital International Airport to other airports in nearby cities based on changes in the epidemic situation, in a bid to ease the mounting pressure on the city that is seeing an increasing number of imported cases of the novel coronavirus.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Two airports－one in Hohhot, capital of the Inner Mongolia autonomous region, and the other in Tianjin－two cities not far from Beijing, began accommodating rerouted inbound flights on March 20 amid the latest efforts to ease the capital's growing pressure from increasing imported infections of COVID-19.
Rerouted passengers and crew will be subject to health and quarantine processes at the three Chinese airports.
Confirmed novel coronavirus cases will be sent to local designated hospitals, while those with symptoms or having had close contact with confirmed cases will be sent to designated quarantine areas in the three cities, it said.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 8th of April 2020, Hainan Health committee announced that if people from Wuhan who have living place in Hainan, they must take a nuclear test within 24 hours after they arrive Hainan and stay at home before the result come out. If People from Wuhan don't have a living place in Hainan and travel Hainan less than 5 days, they must take antibody tests at the border. For people whose results are negative, they are allowed to enter Hainan province, otherwise, their health conditions have to be monitored and they have to take nuclear tests

description:
In order to curb cross-border spread of the virus, Civil Aviation Administration of China announced that Chinese passengers who have purchased return air tickets from the countries listed in the appendix are required to fill in and report their health information in advance for epidemic prevention. Specific requirements are as follows:

1.  Starting from April 8, 2020, passengers who have purchased tickets need to log in the international version of the health QR code in the Wechat mini program to fill in their personal information, daily health status and travel history. The information can be filled in by others under special circumstances.

2.  April 8 to April 22 will be the transition period. Chinese passengers taking flights during this period shall report their information on a daily basis starting from April 8. For Chinese passengers taking flights after the transition period, their information shall be reported on a daily basis starting from the 14th day before boarding the flight.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: April 26, 2020: The government of Suifenhe City, Heilongjiang Province has implemented a local health QR code that prevents local residents from leaving the city. Local residents who have to leave the city for special reasons must provide negative nucleic acid test results within three days before leaving. And after arriving at their destinations, they will be placed under concentrated quarantine for 14 days and receive coronavirus tests two consecutive times.

description: China will strengthen preventive and control efforts against COVID-19 on the nation's borders and land routes, Li Bin, deputy head of the National Health Commission, said on May 8. He said the 34 ports allow only commodity flow, but for a small number of people who still need to go across the borders, transport authorities are working together with customs and health control departments to tighten measures to ensure the passengers are managed in a "closed loop" to minimize the risk of epidemic spreading.

description: From June 8, 2020, Singapore and China started their fast lane agreement to facilitate essential business and official travel between both countries. The fast lane will be established between six Chinese provinces and municipalities (Chongqing, Guangdong, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Tianjin and Zhejiang) and Singapore. The scheme is open to residents in Singapore and China who need to make essential business or official trips between the two countries, and they will be exempt from rules that require everyone else to serve quarantine periods of up to 14 days. They must first agree to be tested and bear the costs.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Gansu province is restricting travel from Beijing starting from 17 June 2020. There is currently one high-risk area and twenty-seven medium risk areas in Beijing. Those coming from low-risk areas would need to provide proof of a negative covid-test result. If unable to, they would be required to test upon entry. Those coming from medium-risk areas would be required to test negative as well as self-isolate for 14 days. Those from high-risk areas would be required to spend 14 days in a quarantine centre.

description: China's civil aviation regulator said A Sichuan Airlines flight from Cairo, Egypt, to Chengdu is suspended. China s civil aviation regulator said on July 1st that a Sichuan Airlines flight from Cairo, Egypt, to Chengdu would be suspended after six passengers tested positive for COVID-19 on a June 27 flight.  The suspension of flight 3U8392, with a duration of one week, starting July 6, was the second of its kind ever imposed following the introduction of a reward and suspension mechanism by the Civil Aviation Administration of China  CAAC  on June 4. The CAAC also said that Sichuan Airlines is not allowed to transfer the original quota of flight 3U8392 to state routes. According to the CAAC policy, if all inbound passengers of an airline test negative for novel coronavirus for three weeks in a row, the operating airline will be allowed to increase its number of flights to two per week. If the number of passengers testing positive reaches five, the airline s flights will be suspended for a week. The suspension will last for four weeks if the number of passengers testing positive reaches 10.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: China s civil aviation regulator said that an Air China flight from Moscow to Beijing would be suspended on July 13. On 10 July, China s civil aviation regulator said that an Air China flight from Moscow to Beijing would be suspended after over five passengers tested positive for COVID-19 on a 4 July flight. The suspension of flight CA910 will last for one week, starting 13 July, and is the fourth of its kind ever imposed following the introduction of a reward and suspension mechanism by the Civil Aviation Administration of China  CAAC  on 4 June. According to the CAAC policy, if all inbound passengers of an airline test negative for novel coronavirus for three weeks in a row, the operating airline will be allowed to increase its number of flights to two per week. If the number of passengers testing positive reaches five, the airline s flights will be suspended for a week. The suspension will last for four weeks if the number of passengers testing positive reaches 10. The CAAC also said that Air China is not allowed to transfer the original quota of flight CA910 to state routes.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
China will cap passenger loads to 75 percent of an aircraft's seats on flights designated a "high risk" for COVID-19 in an effort to contain imported coronavirus cases, the country's aviation regulator said. The administration also required airlines to step up temperature checks and health screening of passengers, reserve isolation areas for emergency use and check passenger health codes and nucleic acid testing certificates.
As a result, the administration has ordered 31 flight suspensions and canceled 52 inbound flights.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From March 28, China temporarily suspends entry by foreign nationals holding visas or residence permits still valid to the time of the announcement on March 26 UPDATE: Effective from 0 a m., 28 September 2020, foreign nationals holding valid Chinese residence permits for work, personal matters and reunion are allowed to enter China with no need for applying for new visas. If the above three categories of residence permits held by foreign nationals expired after 0 a.m., 28 March 2020, the holders may apply for relevant visas by presenting the expired residence permits and relevant materials to the Chinese embassies or consulates on the condition that the purpose of the holders’ visit to China remains unchanged. The above-mentioned personnel shall strictly abide by the Chinese regulations on epidemic prevention and control.

description:
on November 4, 2020, the Chinese government announced that it would temporarily suspend entry into China by non-Chinese nationals in the UK holding visas or residence permits still valid at the time of this announcement. The Chinese Embassy and Consulates in the UK will no longer issue Certified Health Declaration Form for the above-mentioned personnel.

Entry by holders of diplomatic, service, courtesy or C visas will not be affected. Foreign nationals visiting China for emergency needs may apply for visas at Chinese Embassy or Consulates. Entry by non-Chinese nationals in the UK with visas issued after 3 November 2020 will not be affected.

description: Since November 4, 2020, the Chinese embassies in the UK, France, Belgium, Italy, Philippines, Bangladesh, India and Russia have suspended entry into China with currently valid Chinese visas and residence permits for work, private affairs and reunion.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: China has barred non-Chinese travelers from Britain, France, Belgium, the Philippines and India, imposing some of the most stringent entry curbs of any country as coronavirus cases surge around the world. The restrictions cover those with valid visas and residence permits and take effect in conjunction with a more restrictive testing regime for arrivals from several state countries. The blanket bans were announced by the five countries  Chinese embassies.The suspensions were a partial reversal of an easing on September 28, when China allowed all foreigners with valid residence permits to enter.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In order to reduce cross-border transmission of COVID-19 and protect the health and safety of passengers, China starting from 0:00 on November 6, 2020 Pacific Time, all Chinese and foreign passengers bound for China will be required to take nucleic acid and IgM anti-body tests and apply for a green health code with the "HS" mark or a certified health declaration form before boarding the flight.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Chinese Embassy in the UK announced that from Thursday, November 5, all non-Chinese nationals traveling from the UK will be denied entry to China even if they previously held residence permits or visas. The blanket ban on entry into China comes amid a month-long UK coronavirus disease (COVID-19)-related lockdown which will be in effect until December 2. Entry by holders of diplomatic, service, courtesy, or C visas will not be affected. Foreign nationals visiting China for emergency purposes will need to apply for a visa at the Chinese Embassies or one of its  Consulates. The suspension reverses a September 28 partial easing of travel restrictions into the country for non-nationals with resident permits.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hulunbuir Prefecture, Manzhouli City; 26 November 2020. Manzhouli City announces that all outbound borders will be monitored 24 hours a day, and all outbound travelling vehicles and travellers will be strictly inspected and monitored. 

Logistics vehicles and personnel entering and leaving the borders will be inspected, and drivers of the vehicles that meet the disease prevention requirements must follow the principle of "travelling on the same road, operating the vehicle by the same person, and entering and leaving on the same day".
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As from 0:00 on December 1, 2020 Pacific Time, the Chinese Embassy/Consulates General will issue QR code with "HDC" mark for foreign passengers who are to fly from the U.S. to China. Foreign passengers can apply for the QR code with "HDC" mark by logging on the website of https://hrhk.cs.mfa.gov.cn/H5/ via computer or smart phone. The passengers can fill in their information, declare their health status and upload the test certificates, passports, itinerary and other documents as required online, which will then be examined and verified by the Chinese Embassy/Consulates in the U.S. Upon approval, they will receive the QR code with "HDC" mark. Foreign passengers must present the electronic or printed code, and follow the procedures for inspection by relevant airlines during boarding. For test requirements please read the Embassy notice on 29th October 2020 carefully.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since December 1, 2020, all persons (including Chinese nationals) traveling from abroad to destinations in Mainland China must have proof of dual negative results for COVID-19 using both a nucleic acid test and an IgM antibody test. Both tests must be performed no more than 48 hours prior to departure and results must be submitted for approval to a local Chinese embassy or consulate. All persons must undergo a 14-day quarantine at a designated location upon arrival in Mainland China.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Travel restrictions strengthened for Belgium, France, Russia, the Philippines, India, Italy, Bangladesh, the UK, Ukraine, and Ethiopia and travel requirement updates for state countries. Travel Restrictions Authorities are maintaining a ban on foreign nationals traveling from specific countries, including Belgium, France, Russia, the Philippines, India, Italy, Bangladesh, the UK, Ukraine, and Ethiopia. The restrictions do not apply to Chinese nationals, foreign diplomatic passport holders, and individuals with C visas. Foreign nationals from state countries with valid residence permits for work, visiting family, and personal matters currently can re-enter China. Specially designated foreign workers with invitation letters issued by provincial or municipal government officials can also enter the country. Some immediate family members of foreign employees may obtain visas to enter for emergency humanitarian purposes. Diplomatic personnel and C visa holders - generally flight and shipping crew members - are exempt from entry bans.Additionally, officials are permitting essential business travel from Singapore and South Korea under fast-track arrangements.Authorities require most arriving passengers from abroad to take a nucleic acid COVID-19 test at designated facilities in the country of origin within three days of departure for China. Officials require all authorized inbound passengers from specified countries to provide evidence of both nucleic acid COVID-19 and IgM antibody t
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On Dec.7th, the Taiping region of Chengdu City was classified to "medium risk" after confirmation of 5 local covid cases. On Dec.8th, the Disease Control Department of Henan Province issued all travellers arriving from the Taiping region since Nov. 23rd to report to the local unit to participate in safety investigation (e.g. report travelling history, recent activities and contacts, proof of negative covid test in recent 7 days). The department also strongly suggested those travellers arriving from other regions of Chengdu since Nov. 23rd to monitor their health condition. All residents should not travel to Chengdu or any regions at risk unless it's essential. Those that are travelling must report to the local unit for record-keeping. The policy has ended on Dec.21st, after the Taiping region is reclassified to "low risk" with no new cases identified in the 2 weeks period.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 13, Xiantao, Hubei decided that those who need to return to Xiantao from medium and low-risk areas in the province must hold a Hubei "health code" green code or a health monitoring certificate, and pass through the control points after inspection, registration and temperature measurement; people from high-risk areas in the province can return by a “point-to-point” method, holding a Hubei "Health Code" green code or health monitoring certificate, and approved by the municipal headquarters for the pandemic prevention and control.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Temporary travel ban on all foreign nationals from Canada. China has temporarily blocked entry to foreign national travelling from Canada, even those with current residency permits. The Chinese embassy in Ottawa said on January 30, in view of the current Covid-19 situation and the need of epidemic prevention and control, all foreign nationals who hold valid Chinese residence permits for work, personal matters and reunion are temporarily not allowed to enter China from Canada. A few categories of visa holder, including those with diplomatic stamps, would be exempted.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control urges the community to stay local during the Chinese New Year and avoid travelling overseas or going to medium and high-risk areas in China unless necessary.

Cadres and employees of the party and government organs, public institutions, and state-owned enterprises should take the lead in celebrating Chinese New Year locally to minimise the risk of spreading the virus caused by people's movement. If travelling is necessary, they must report to the unit in advance, ensure to practise personal preventive measures, and accurately record their activity history.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable),Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable),Migrant workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that:

- Travellers from overseas and domestic medium and high-risk areas should suspend coming/returning to Inner Mongolia when possible. If necessary, they must implement control measures, which include a 14-day centralised quarantine, a 7-day home quarantine, and 3 nucleic acid tests (done on the 1st, 14th, and 21st days respectively).

- Travellers from high-risk areas or with a history of staying in high-risk areas in China in the past 14 days should undergo a 14-day centralised quarantine and 2 nucleic acid tests. Those coming from medium-risk areas in China or with a history of staying in medium-risk areas in the past 14 days should undergo a 14-day home quarantine and 2 nucleic acid tests.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
In order to stop trans-border spread of COVID-19, personnel intending to travel to China need to take nucleic acid and antibody (IgM) tests at designated institutions starting from 19th February 2021.

Detailed requirements are as follows:

I. Taking Nucleic Acid and Antibody Tests in Designated Institutions

a, Travelers to China need to take nucleic acid and antibody tests at institutions designated by the Chinese Embassy and Consulates-General in the UK (the list can be found at the end of this page) on the day or within the previous 2 days of departure from the UK. Tests taken at institutions that are not on the list will not be accepted.

b, When providing nucleic acid and antibody samples, travelers are advised to request the institution to inform the Chinese Embassy or Consulates-General in the UK of the test results, and authorize the institutions to share necessary personal information, including but not limited to name, gender, date of birth, passport number and test results.

c, Only those tested negative for nucleic acid and IgM antibody are to be issued the digital Health Declaration Form with HDC sign for traveling to China.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
China suggests 'No necessary, No travel China' for the overseas residents and international travelers. Coming to China should fly by direct flights between Australia and China for every passenger. Chinese embassies and consulates abroad will no longer issue green health codes or health status declarations for people who intend to transit to China in third countries (except for countries or regions that are not navigable).
And please upload the "double test" negative certificate as required.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: Starting from Mar. 15, 2021, the Chinese embassy in U.S. will provide visa application conveniences for those who have been fully vaccinated by a China-manufactured COVID-19 vaccine. description: On April 16, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. provided more detailed requirements for traveling passengers who have been vaccinated by a non-Inactivated vaccine (Pfizer, Moderna etc.): 1) For those who has been vaccinated, a IgM test is still required. 2) IgM test result may be positive for those who have been vaccinated. description: China, Inner Mongolia, Hulunbuir Prefecture; 5 August 2021. Hulunbuir Prefecture Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that all airports, railway stations, and city borders must be strictly monitored. Traffic checkpoints should be set up at the entrances and exits of Hulunbuir city centre (Hailar District and Bayantuohai Town, Evenki Banner). According to the principle of "avoid going out unless necessary ", the flow of populations across borders should be minimised. Those who must go out will need to hold a negative nucleic acid test certificate obtained within the last 48 hours.

description: Hainan Province released Health Code for monitoring health condition of all residents, travelers, passengers, and workers after Feb. 18 2020. There are three different color of the code as different risk level. Green is normal; Yellow is mid-level risk; and Red is High-level risk. Green allows people go outside normally. People having yellow and red code are restricted going out. People have yellow and red code should submit everyday health condition for 14 days. After the staff checked the condition is healthy. Yellow or red code will turn into green.

description:
Henan, China issued a series of policies to prevent infections in medical institutions and protect medical personnel from being infected on Feb 28. 
For example, medical institutions are required to set up checkpoints at the entrance and exit of the areas reported/potentially reported cases of COVID-19. Supervisors should be set up in order to provide guidance and assistance to medical staff in putting on and taking off protective equipment. They must be familiar with the the use of personal protective equipment and the methods of dealing with occupational exposure.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable)

description: As of March 13, 2020, the Jiangsu Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention and an expert team have investigated clusters of coronavirus cases. Infected or suspected cases were asked face-to-face where they have been in the past 14 days, what transportation they had taken, and who they have been in contact with. The investigators collected information on the relationship between the cases, contact history, environmental facilities at the outbreak site, prevention and control measures from sites such as major hospitals, community health service centers, residential communities, and other places in the region.

description:
Henan, China launched the digital "health status code" on Mar 17, which has three "colors", indicating health assessment of a person.
"Red code" is for people who are diagnosed or to be diagnosed with coronavirus. They must be treated in designated hospitals. 
"Yellow code" is for people who have symptoms like fever, coughing, a sore throat and shortness of breath or who are cured in less than 14 days. They must be self-quarantined under supervision of the community.
"Green code" is for the rest of people. One with the "green code" and a normal temperature can travel or return to work within/between provinces.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Since March. 31. 2020, Henan started a comprehensive investigation to exclude the risks of the spread of COVID-19, and enhance the regulation of people with asymptomatic infection. 
1. The policy asked to comprehensively check the hidden danger by investigating those who came back to Henan from other places again, monitoring the health status of medical staff, enhancing the investigation of construction companies, Pension agency, Children's Welfare Institute. 
2. The policy asked to intensify screening of asymptomatic infections and the investigation of close contacts. Once identifying any asymptomatic infections, people with asymptomatic infections and their close contacts should be quarantined immediately.
3. The policy asked to immediately isolate patients with fever, cough, etc.
4. The policy asked to report suspected, confirmed cases and asymptomatic infections within 2 hours.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 30, the Office of the Leading Group (Command) of Shandong Provincial Committee for Epidemic Prevention and Control and Economic Operation issued the Notice requires further strengthening the management of people returning to Shandong in winter and spring and achieve fully initiative declaration of information on people returning to Shandong.
According to the Notice, the "Initiative Declaration System for Epidemic Prevention and Control of People Returning to Shandong" has been put online. Relevant individuals can access it by scanning the code through WeChat or logging into the "Love Shandong" APP, and initiatively declaring the departure place, destination, nucleic acid test, contact information and other related contents.
The notice is effective from 31 January 2021 and valid until 15 March 2021.

description: On February 19, the Guangdong Provincial Health Commission issued an announcement, stating that residents who have been to high-risk areas in China in the past 14 days or have lived abroad in the past 21 days (less than 7 days after the quarantine is lifted) must follow relevant national requirements , Carry out the new crown nucleic acid test in time before departure, and report to the unit, property, residence hotel, or destination community committee (village committee) as soon as possible after arriving in Guangdong. Try to avoid going to public places and crowded places, take personal protection, temperature monitoring and other health management measures, and make personal health declarations on the "Yuekang Code" through the WeChat applet "Guangdong Province Affairs". Those who come to Guangdong and return to Guangdong from other areas of the city where the medium and high-risk areas are located should do a new crown nucleic acid test within 7 days before departure.

description:
To effectively control and reduce the spread of coronavirus during the Ching Ming holiday, the Henan Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued the following reminders:
1. Avoid visiting Ruili City in Yunnan Province due to its recent confirmed covid cases. If travelling is necessary, one should report to the local health unit upon return, complying with any relevant health measures. 
2. Those who have visited Ruili City, or have contacted related personnel since March 14, 2021, should take the initiative to visit the community health unit for nucleic acid testing. Upon any signs of respiratory symptoms such as fever, sore throat, cough etc., one should be immediately transferred to the designated medical institution for treatment following standardized procedures.
3. It is recommended that everyone who meets the vaccination requirements should get vaccinated for the safety consideration of all.

description: On 27/03/2022, Jilin province has strengthened epidemic prevention and control at construction sites, and 19 makeshift hospitals have been built in the province. Among them, 8 are in Changchun city, 10 are in Jilin City and 1 is in Hunchun City, Yanbian Prefecture.We need to hold all parties accountable. The responsibilities of local governments, enterprises and industry sectors should be clearly defined to prevent the spread of the epidemic. Second, we must strictly implement the requirements of "four should be four." Nucleic acid screening and antigen testing were carried out for all personnel to ensure that no one was left behind. Rapid and accurate screening and screening were carried out. Positive patients were transferred to designated hospitals and makeshift hospitals for treatment as soon as possible. In addition, the strictest closed-loop management should be implemented. We will promptly formulate concrete plans and take tough measures to prevent people from gathering and moving around. Strict implementation of temperature registration, wearing masks, health code and other regulations, eliminate all risks and hidden dangers. Finally, professional elimination should be carried out comprehensively. Adhere to the combination of preventive elimination and terminal elimination, workers' dormitories, dining halls and other key places, professional and meticulous environmental elimination, and carry out evaluation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 25, 2020, Hubei announced that economic and information bureaus of all cities, prefectures, municipalities directly under management, and forest districts in the province must establish a system for uniformly deploying new-type pneumonia protective materials from that day. 
All bureaus must appoint special personnel to the designated factories and establish a station system of one factory (or multiple factories) per person. 
The scope of product monitoring includes surgical masks (including N95 masks), medical protective clothing, disinfection products, protective masks, goggles, positive pressure isolation gowns, etc. 
The responsibilities of the stationed personnel are: immediately take the strictest measures urging enterprises to hand over all epidemic prevention materials to the Material Guarantee Team of the Provincial Headquarters for Prevention and Control. Following the allocation plan issued by the province, appointed personnel should notify the enterprises to organize production, and should supervise and manage the existing inventory, daily output, planned allocation, statistics on in and out of warehouses, and the next day's production schedule.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, the Lhasa Gonggar Airport Customs Office under the Lhasa Customs opened a green channel to quickly inspect and release Tibet's first batch of emergency supplies for the prevention and control of the coronavirus infection. This batch of supplies includes 2,700 N95 masks, 12,000 general surgical masks, and 300 goggles. Besides, Lhasa Customs has opened a green channel for epidemic prevention and control materials in all subordinate customs, and publicly announced the contact information of various business departments such as emergency prevention and control materials, customs clearance, tariff reduction, inspection and supervision through the Lhasa Customs WeChat official account and website. Once the declaration of emergency prevention and control materials is received, the customs will open the green channel and go through the customs clearance procedures for the relevant materials as soon as possible to ensure that the materials are inspected and cleared quickly.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Pandemic Emergency Command Center in Sichuan declared that factories which manufactured resources helping the prevention of the pandemic, including facemasks, personal protection equipments and electrical thermometers, should resume their production on January 30. The provincial government would appoint liaison officers to coordinate with those factories on material supply, manufacture equipments, logistics, energy and finance.

The provincial government offered tax reduction for the factories which manufactured resources helping the prevention of the pandemic. Also, banks and financial institutions were ordered to offer better interest rates to those factories.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On March 14, 2020, the Leading Group for Epidemic Prevention and Control in Jiangsu issued a notice providing instruction and guidance for localities to guarantee the production of medical protective clothing, masks, and other supplies. Departments of Industry and Information Technology at different localities are expected to guide producers of medical supplies so that they comply with the standard for quality and management of medical apparatus production after sufficient communication with drug safety authorities. The enterprises are to enhance management at key areas including process control, purchase of raw materials, delivery inspection, and tag mark management, and quality improvement of products.

description:
On March 14, it was announced that Chinese doctors were coming to work in Tunisia. Stocks of antibacterial gels and protective masks will also be supplied by China. According to Doctor Dhaker Lahidheb, a doctor practicing at the Tunis Military Hospital, a team of high-level Chinese doctors will soon travel to Tunisia, provided with effective drugs designed, according to him, to fight against the coronavirus.
In a statement released the same evening, the Presidency of the Republic of Tunisia welcomed the Chinese initiative.

description: On 2020 May 12, an Asiana Airlines flight carrying 61 tons of anti-epidemic supplies left Yantai, Shandong province, for Los Angeles. In order to ensure the rapid clearance of anti-epidemic materials, the Exit and Entry Border Inspection Station of Yantai Airport optimized the process of cargo entry and exit inspection, and implemented the guarantee of "all-time, all-weather and zero-waiting" clearance, saving 40 minutes of clearance time for each flight on average.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Anti-epidemic materials donated by central China's Hubei Province, once hard hit by COVID-19, were handed over to Mongolia on December 15,2020 as gifts in appreciation of their previous donation of sheep in support of China's COVID-19 fight.
This batch of anti-epidemic materials, consisting of 30,000 testing kits and 3 units of PCR testingequipment, left Wuhan on December 12. They left the port of Erenhot on December 15 at 4:54 p.m., making use of strict safety measures and cold-chain transportation.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
