description:
Since the outbreak of the imported epidemic in Jilin Province on January 10, the three policies of "anti-epidemic green channel" and emergency transportation in key areas and subsidizing bus operators have effectively guaranteed the transfer of epidemic prevention materials, production and living materials and personnel in key areas of Jilin Province.
In order to ensure emergency transportation in key areas such as Tonghua and Gongzhuling, vehicles transporting supplies for epidemic prevention and control, production and living materials and prevention and control personnel to Tonghua and Gongzhuling are exempted from road tolls with the "Vehicle Permit for Transport of Emergency Materials".
The Department of Transport of Jilin Province has implemented a one-off fund subsidy policy of 1000 yuan for each bus operator, and has given priority to Changchun, Tonghua and Songyuan.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
1. For the nucleic acid testing costs in Tonghua, Changchun, Songyuan and other places where the epidemic prevention and control situation is severe, the provincial finance will provide a subsidy of 60% of the nucleic acid testing costs to the regions with intermediate risk levels (including intermediate) on the basis of the full cost borne by the existing dependent governments.
2. For medical personnel sent to the worst-hit areas to participate in the prevention and control of the first-line epidemic, the subsidy policy of the medical teams to Hubei province will be followed, and the subsidy standard will be doubled on the basis of the national subsidy standard. The funds needed will be fully borne by the provincial finance.
3. For Tonghua, Changchun, Songyuan and other areas with severe epidemic prevention and control situation, the provincial finance will provide necessary one-off financial subsidies according to the actual situation. At the same time, the central and provincial transfer payment subsidies for epidemic prevention and control, medical services and security capacity, and public health have been given priority and consideration as a major factor.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities

description: On February 14, Pandemic Emergency Command Center in Sichuan declared that persons, who has lived in Sichuan for 14 days and needed to travel to work in another city, could have the free Coronavirus health check services at country/town/community health centers. The Coronavirus health check services included epidemiological investigations and temperature checks etc. and health centers were required to issue Proof of Health Declaration for Migrant Workers in Sichuan. Proof of Health Declaration for Migrant Workers in Sichuan could be used as proof of health status for workplaces in Sichuan. The Coronavirus health check services began on February 17 and would last until the pandemic is over.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On April 27th, 2020, Henan released a new policy on nucleic acid testing: the process of nucleic acid testing for the new coronavirus has been optimized, and a detailed testing process has been developed for different groups of people. For patients who are seriously ill or have limited mobility, the nursing staff in their ward will collect specimens for them in the "emergency observation room". Patients with fever or respiratory symptoms during hospitalization, are immediately transferred to the "emergency observation room" of their ward for isolation and are issued with a request for nucleic acid testing for the new coronavirus, and are returned to the "emergency observation room" for isolation after specimen collection. For general inpatients requesting nucleic acid testing during hospitalization, the supervising physician/doctor on duty will issue a request for nucleic acid testing for new coronavirus and direct the patient to the fever clinic for specimen collection. Accompanying persons requiring nucleic acid testing will also be directed to the fever clinic by the staff.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Gansu Provincial Health Commission announced the list of the first 46 medical and health institutions that are able to carry our nucleic acid tests for the novel coronavirus. Gansu province will test all of the following eight groups of people for free: close contacts, overseas arrivals, fever outpatients, newly hospitalized patients and accompanying staff, medical staff, port quarantine and border force officers, prison staff, and staff of social welfare and elderly care institutions. People who are not in these eight groups are not required to be tested but they can still access these testing services upon request.

description: In accordance with the State Council's notice on June 9, 2020, localities are instructed to accelerate the construction of nucleic acid testing laboratories, improve testing capabilities, and meet inspection requirements. Institutions that have met the standards can carry out COVID-19 nucleic acid testing should aim to increase its maximum daily testing volume. Institutions not meeting the standard should attempt to do so as quickly as possible. The provincial clinical testing center is responsible for the acceptance review of clinical gene amplification testing laboratories in medical institutions and testing laboratories. Nucleic acid detection can only be carried out after the second-level biosafety laboratory filing, the acceptance of gene amplification inspection technology, and the biosafety risk assessment. Medical institutions and testing laboratories are to follow the "New Coronavirus Testing Quality Control Work Plan of Jiangsu and participate in external quality evaluation activities. Those who fail to pass the test shall not carry out inspection work.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On January 27th, Luohe held an emergency coronavirus response drill in the city square of Shiwulidian Village, Longcheng Town. More than 220 participants participated in the drill. They were staff members from public security, transportation, medical and disease control center, primary medical care unit, emergency transfer, inspection testing and safety assurance. The drill prepared the staffing members in case of residents returning from other areas started to show susceptible symptoms such as coughing and fatigue. Starting with risk evaluation at the village clinic, to case report, emergency transfer, root cause investigation, disinfection, village-wide quarantine and nucleic acid testing etc. The drill was put in place at this critical time to prepare the staffing members for the Chinese New Year holiday, which increases the risk of entering the virus from outside the village.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Health testing of entire population under the government's jurisdiction
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description:
On February 5, 2021, the cost of group testing of COVID-19 in Guangxi, China, is 20 yuan per person. Compared to the price of single-person nucleic acid testing, the cost per person is reduced by nearly 60 yuan, a drop of more than 70%. Testing is open to all citizens far below cost.

Medical institutions are also not allowed to charge outpatient consultation fees if the patients only need perform the COVID-19 testing. description:
Hebei, China issued the Guidelines for preventive disinfection in schools and kindergartens on February 1st, 2020 to provide instructions on how to use disinfectants. Daily cleaning and preventive disinfection focuses on cleaning, supplemented by preventive disinfection. Over-disinfection should be avoided, and cleaning and disinfection should be carried out at any time when contaminated.
　　(1) Air disinfection in classrooms, libraries and other places: natural ventilation is preferred, and doors and windows should be opened for ventilation as much as possible; the air-conditioning system should ensure the safety of air supply, and the exhaust air should be directly discharged outdoors, without the use of chemical disinfectants everywhere.
　　(2) Environmental surface disinfection: regularly disinfect the ground, wall, elevator and other surfaces.
　　(3) Disinfection of frequently used or touched items: 0.1% peroxyacetic acid solution and chlorine (bromine) disinfectant solution with an effective chlorine (bromine) content of 500 mg/L can be used on tables, chairs, faucets, etc. that are in contact with the human body , Chlorine dioxide solution with a chlorine dioxide content of 250mg/L is regularly wiped or sprayed for disinfection. After 30 minutes of action, wipe with clean water to remove residual disinfectant.
　　(4) Disinfection of tableware: circulating steam disinfection for 20 minutes; or boiling for 15-30 minutes; or using a far-infrared disinfecti

description: On January 21st, 2021, Hebei, China announced the hierarchical management and control of rural domestic garbage in high, middle, and low-risk areas of the epidemic. In high and middle risk areas, all domestic garbage generated is collected and disposed of as medical waste, and the medical waste disposal unit or emergency disposal unit is responsible for transfer and disposal. The domestic garbage produced in other high and medium risk areas other than the above circumstances should be disinfected before being collected and transported and subjected to incineration and other harmless treatments. Domestic garbage in low-risk areas should be collected and transported after disinfection, and the garbage cans, garbage trucks, garbage transfer stations, garbage treatment facilities and other links should be disinfected. It is strictly forbidden to collect and transport undisinfected domestic garbage.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On February 20th, 2021, the National Health Commission of China announced the evaluation standard for disinfection effect on COVID-19 in laboratories. In experiments for inactivated vaccines, carrier materials should be selected according to disinfection objects. The carrier used must be degreased before being infected with the virus. The degreasing process proceeds as follows: a) put the carrier in the detergent containing water and boil for 30 minutes. b) rinse with tap water. c) boil with distilled water for 10 minutes. d) rinse with distilled water until the pH is neutral. e) let it dry and set aside.

description: China is locking down Wuhan from 10 am on January 23, 2020. City buses, subways, ferries, long-distance coaches, flights, and trains for outgoing passengers, would be suspended. Vehicles that had already departed and on the road should go back. UPDATE: China, Wuhan: On Wednesday, April 8, people were permitted to leave the city of Wuhan (Hubei province) for the first time since the lockdown was imposed on Monday, January 27, as authorities begin to ease local restrictions. Wuhan residents encouraged to stay home.

description:
On January 27, 2020, the Department of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of Hubei ordered all Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments within the province to, under the unified leadership of the local party committee and government (the epidemic prevention and control command headquarters), effectively perform departmental responsibilities, strengthen organization leadership, set up special work teams, specify the responsibility of product transportation to each individual personnel, check on the progress daily, and strengthen government duties. 
The departments must establish a working mechanism for the transportation of “vegetable basket” products and feed and other production inputs with relevant departments, and clarify the docking and coordination of designated personnel. They must make plans, strengthen scheduling, and adjust surplus and shortages. They should guide the business entities to prepare a transportation plan, clarifying the transportation vehicles, passengers (only drivers and brokers), and past routes, and coordinating them into transportation channels. The departments should cooperate with relevant departments to open up “green channels”, set up designated channels, and implement measures such as “point-to-point” transportation to ensure smooth transportation of urgently needed materials such as vegetables and feed.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that official vehicles, ambulances, fire trucks, garbage trucks, postal vehicles, emergency repair vehicles, etc. can pass directly in the city administrative area. Other vehicles can go on the road only with a vehicle pass issued by the headquarters for the prevention and control of the pandemic. For pandemic prevention work, public officials and related personnel living in the main urban area may take epidemic prevention and control work vehicles at a designated place. For enterprises producing epidemic prevention materials in the city administrative area, vehicles that need to be used can pass after inspection and verification, and vehicles to transport employees can pass through with a permit issued by the prevention and control of the pandemic. Vehicles ensuring the transportation of daily necessities in the city can pass after inspection. Social vehicles that must go to the hospital for an emergency treatment can pass after appropriate registration based on circumstances.

description: On February 17, Xiantao, Hubei set certain intersections’ all traffic lights to red lights and banned all vehicles to drive through, except authorized special vehicles including emergency transport vehicles that guaranteed supplies, official cars, postal cars, ambulances, garbage trucks, fire trucks, and funeral cars. The intersections include 3 intersections at Heli Road (Qingqing Home Intersection, South Heli Bridge Intersection, and North Heli Bridge Intersection), and 2 intersections at Mianjie Avenue (Jinrui Road Intersection and Qiantao Road Intersection). Unauthorized passes in the intersections would be dealt with according to law by Public Security Traffic Police Department. Those disobey and run the red light would be recorded to the traffic violation processing platform according to the Road Traffic Safety Law of the People’s Republic of China. This restriction will end when the pandemic emergency response ends.

description:

The definition of the Coronavirus hotspots is: (1) the high risk areas in Sichuan; (2) Hubei province; (3) the high risk areas in the provinces other than Hubei; (4) the other countries/regions hit hard by Coronavirus.

description: On January 29 starting at 18:00, Xiantao, Hubei banned all vehicles in the central city, except authorized special vehicles including emergency transport vehicles that guaranteed supplies, official cars, postal cars, ambulances, garbage trucks, fire trucks, and funeral cars. Unauthorized passes in the central city would be dealt with according to law by the public security traffic police department. On March 13, Xiantao, Hubei announced that according to a differentiated measure of prevention and control requirements that divide districts and levels, all city traffic control points except key areas are removed. UPDATE: All city traffic control points except key areas have been removed.

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that official vehicles, ambulances, fire trucks, garbage trucks, postal vehicles, emergency repair vehicles, etc. can pass directly in the city. Other vehicles can go on the road only with a vehicle pass issued by the headquarters for the prevention and control of the pandemic. For pandemic prevention work, public officials and related personnel living in the main urban area may take epidemic prevention and control work vehicles at a designated place. For enterprises producing epidemic prevention materials in the city, vehicles that need to be used can pass after inspection and verification, and vehicles to transport employees can pass through with a permit issued by the prevention and control of the pandemic. Vehicles ensuring daily necessities transport in the city can pass after inspection. Social vehicles that must go to the hospital for an emergency treatment can pass after appropriate registration based on circumstances. On February 13, for intra-city transportation of livestock and poultry feed; veterinary drugs, vaccines, livestock, and poultry epidemic prevention products; live pigs and products; urgently need agricultural materials, fruits and vegetables, vehicles (with no more than 2 passengers) shall be released quickly. Point-to-point transportation of adult fish will be released quickly after inspecion, temperature measure, and registration. On March 13, all city traffic control points except key areas were removed. UPDATE: All city traffic control points except key areas are removed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel.

To Beijing

From low-risk areas: a green health code, register personal information on the JingXinXiangZhu (京心相助) WeChat mini program, make contact with their community or company in advance. People from low-risk areas under closed management in Beijing should have their health conditions monitored locally for 14 days.

From medium-risk areas: a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 72 hours before boarding; a 14-day home observation or isolated observation when the conditions for home observation can't be met.

From high-risk areas: a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 72 hours before boarding; a 14-day isolated observation.

Anyone in close contact with a confirmed or asymptomatic case should have a strict "14+7+7" health management service – a 14-day isolated medical observation at designated sites such as hotel rooms, followed by a 7-day home monitoring of health conditions, with an ensuing 7-day general monitoring of health conditions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
From 28th of January 2021, people who is going to travel to Tianjin China have to obey the following rules.

From low-risk areas: a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 7 days, a 14-day home quarantine and medical observation, a nucleic acid test every 7 days during observation.

From medium or high-risk areas: people who have left the medium or high-risk areas for 14 days and hold a negative nucleic acid test report can move freely; people who have left for less than 14 days should provide a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 3 days before arrival in Tianjin, and must undergo an isolated observation until they have left for 14 days, as well as two nucleic acid tests.

From low-risk areas in the administrative divisions where a medium or high-risk area is located: in addition to Shijiazhuang, Xingtai, Langfang in Hebei province and Daxing district in Beijing, people from other low-risk areas in the districts or cities where a medium or high-risk area is located should provide a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 3 days; those unable to provide a report should immediately take a nucleic acid test and stay home for observation until the result is issued.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel at 28th of January 2021.

To Shijiazhuang, Hebei province

At the Hebei province epidemic prevention and control press conference held on Jan 12, it was requested that epidemic control sites be set up at all the borderline entrances and exits of Shijiazhuang and its Gaocheng district, as well as Xingtai and its county-level city of Nangong. People with intention to enter or leave the above areas should be persuaded to abandon the journey. Twenty-four-hour patrols will be conducted on the rural roads of the above areas to ensure that vehicles and personnel will not leave the villages, counties, and cities. In the cities of Shijiazhuang and Xingtai, pavement patrols by traffic police will promptly discover and deal with vehicles and personnel traveling in violation of relevant rules.

People from Shijiazhuang who are in other places should not return to the city unless absolutely necessary. They must contact their community before returning.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel at 28th of January 2021.

To Taiyuan, Shanxi province

From low-risk areas in Hebei province: a negative nucleic acid test report conducted within 72 hours; people unable to provide a report should immediately take a seamless and hermetic nucleic acid test followed by a 14-day home quarantine and medical observation.

From other low-risk areas: a green health code and a digital travel record, report to their administrative division.

From medium-risk areas: a 14-day home quarantine or isolated observation when the conditions for home observation can't be met, two nucleic acid tests.

From high-risk areas: a 14-day isolated observation, two nucleic acid tests.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel on 28th of January 2021.

To Harbin, Heilongjiang province

From low-risk areas: a green health code.

From medium or high-risk areas: report to their community (village) or company or the hotel they are staying at, a 14-day isolated medical observation, a 7-day community health management period, three nucleic acid tests.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel on 28th of January 2021.

To Shanghai

From low-risk areas: a green health code.

From medium-risk areas: a 14-day community health management, two nucleic acid tests.

From high-risk areas: a 14-day isolated quarantine and observation, two nucleic acid tests.

People who come from medium or high-risk areas have to report to the community or company or the hotel they are staying at within 12 hours after arrival in Shanghai.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
To cope with the challenging situation of epidemic prevention and control, China 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions released rules for trans-provincial travel on 28th of January 2021.

To Nanjing, Jiangsu province

From low-risk areas: a green health code.

From medium-risk areas: those who have left the medium-risk areas for less than 14 days must be quarantined until they have left for 14 days; all individuals have to stay at home for observation until they have been outside the medium-risk areas for 28 days.

*For specific quarantine measures for those coming from medium or high-risk areas, please inquire about Nanjing Bendibao (南京本地宝) WeChat account.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

To Urumqi, Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region

description:
On Feb 3, 2021, it is announced at the provincial education conference that primary and secondary schools in Jiangsu province are adopting enclosed management. The relevant plan requires that school faculty and staff do not travel across provinces, and guide students and parents not to travel across provinces unless necessary. Strictly following the "daily report" system for the health of teachers, students, and family members.
14 days before the start of school, all teachers, students, and staff will have to check and record their daily temperature. Teachers and students who have travelled to districts and cities where the medium- and high-risk areas are located shall be checked for a negative nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days.

Schools started on 22/02/2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Gansu is restricting travel during the Spring Festival travel rush period between Jan 18 to Mar 8, 2021. Those who have been to high-risk areas in the past 14 days are not permitted to travel. Those who have been to medium risk areas should not travel without a permit and are required to show a negative covid test result from the past 72 hours.

description: The Anhui provincial government restricted traveling within the province during the Chinese New Year holiday, which is from February 11th to 17th. Citizens that have been to high-risk areas in the past two weeks are banned from travel. Citizens that have been to medium-risk areas in the past two weeks can only travel provided with permission from the local CDC and a negative NAT testing report within 72 hours. Citizens that are in low-risk areas can travel provided with a negative NAT testing report within 1 week. The government also discouraged traveling to medium and high-risk areas.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
1, during the Spring Festival 2021 to minimize the flow of people and travel risks, advocate the local Spring Festival; If you really need to return to Zouping, please report the return time, travel and residence history within 14 days and whether you are engaged in cold chain logistics industry to the village community of the destination in advance. Those with a history of travel and residence in medium-high risk areas and those engaged in cold chain logistics industry should provide a negative nucleic acid test report within 7 days and report to the village where the destination is located three days in advance. Concealer will be subject to investigation.
2. On the way back to Zou, personal protection should be strictly carried out. If conditions permit, it is recommended that college students and migrant workers who are close to zou take private cars or chartered cars as far as possible. If you take public transportation such as high-speed trains and airplanes, do not remove your face mask except for necessary meals and water, and do personal protection and health monitoring such as hand disinfection on the way. Minimize the number of meals you eat on public transport and don't talk to strangers; Keep the bills properly for inquiry.
3. After entering Zou and returning to Zou, it is not necessary to go to supermarkets, schools, libraries, cinemas, Internet cafes and other public places, and it is not necessary to have dinner.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On 8th May 2021, the Gansu government announced that candidates in the National College Entrance Examination (NCEE) are prohibited to leave Gansu 14 days before the exam. If candidates have suspected symptoms of Covid-19 within 14 days before the test, or high-risk, medium-risk areas, or overseas travel history within 14 days before the test, they can only take the test with a negative nucleic acid test certificate issued by the nearest designated hospital or third-party testing agencies.

description: On 3 August 2021, Guangxi, China, issued a notice to advise residents to not leave Guangxi unless necessary. People who leave Guangxi must report to their units and their communities, and they can travel only after the unit and the community agree. They will report to the unit and the community within 12 hours after returning and receive health management services. In the near future, it is recommended to travel by self-driving short-distance tours to reduce the risk of infection while traveling.

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Hulunbuir Prefecture; 5 August 2021. The prefecture's Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that all localities should minimise the flow of populations within the area. description:
On 28 January 2020, Shaanxi Province advised citizens to refrain from going out and obeying the prevention and control measures carried out by disease prevention and control agencies in accordance with the law. 

As of February 21, 2020, certain districts and counties in Xi'an city have eased the management of closed communities. For neighborhoods with no COVID-19 cases and no close contacts in the last 14 days, the restriction -- residents only going out every 2 days for purchasing essential supplies -- has been lifted. UPDATE: The original policy does not have a clear end date, but the update policy announced on Feb 21, 2020 suggested a lift in the management.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On February 24, China's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council barred visitors to prisons.

Starting from February 24, 2020, Shaanxi province has lifted the closure of village groups and communities. The closure will only remain in effect for villages and communities with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 cases within the last 14 days. Instead of closure, the committees will now appoint a dedicated person to oversee the health management of all individuals within their respective areas. For proper monitoring, QR code checks for the health status of individuals entering or leaving Shaanxi will be conducted. Additionally, preventive measures such as ventilation and regular disinfection in public areas like elevators and corridors will continue to be enforced to curb the spread of the virus.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Since midnight on May 18, 2020, the epidemic prevention and control work has been further strengthened throughout the region, and strict closed control measures have been implemented in residential communities.
1.For the community (residential area) and other basic units with confirmed (including clinical diagnosis) cases, firmly implement closed and hard isolation, in principle, prohibit any personnel to enter or leave. Necessary materials for residents' daily life shall be distributed centrally by the community, and once every three days by the family. Staff and workers of organs, enterprises and institutions guaranteeing basic production and living shall enter or leave their residential communities according to their work needs on the strength of their work certificates.
2. For other communities (residential areas) with general closed management, each family shall assign one member of the family to go out once a day to purchase living materials with the community pass, and each outing is limited to 2 hours. Do not carry out according to this stipulation, exceed time, cancel the qualification of enter and exit district. Except for the needs of epidemic prevention and control, medical treatment of sick people, emergency response and provision of necessary public services, other people are not allowed to go out.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hulunbuir Prefecture; 5 August 2021. Hulunbuir City Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that: 

- All organs/enterprises/businesses/commercial venues must assume the primary responsibility for the detailed implementation of the epidemic prevention and control measures. 

- Every locality must be responsible for its region, in which each department must take the regulatory responsibility for monitoring their relevant industries. They must strictly manage people flow in densely populated venues and order shut down if any organ/enterprise/business fails to implement the required measures (e.g., mask-wearing, crowd control, ventilation, and disinfection).

description: On January 23, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels in the province to strictly implement an epidemic report system and relevant regulations on emergency duty, strengthen information reporting and work shifts, and ensure a smooth flow of government orders. In conjunction with the African Swine Fever daily report, the departments should report daily investigations on time. If an abnormal death occurred, the departments should report in time according to prescribed procedures to ensure early detection, early reporting, early diagnosis, and early disposal of the epidemic. The departments must strictly enforce disciplines of epidemic reporting, and strictly prohibit concealment, omission, late reporting, misreporting, and false reporting.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: The Agriculture and Rural Departments of all levels in the province must report on animal diseases daily.

description: On January 23, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels in the province to strengthen the disease investigation of livestock and poultry in key areas and links, considering human infections. The departments should focus on live livestock and poultry trading markets, (agricultural) markets, large-scale farms, etc., combine key investigations with active monitoring, and carry out epidemiological investigations to find out the virus contamination base, to timely study and judge the internal connection between the new coronavirus and viruses carried by livestock and poultry. The departments must increase sampling and monitoring of farms and their environment, make timely epidemic risk assessments, and strengthen poultry disease prevention and control measures. The departments must actively cooperate with the forestry department in carrying out disease surveillance in wild animal domestication and breeding farms, timely sample and inspect animals that died of unknown causes and report under regulations.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
On January 24, 2020, the Public Security Department of Hubei Province issued an emergency notice requesting local public security agencies to closely cooperate with relevant departments to do their best to carry out transportation support and guarantee related work.
The notice required that the Provincial Public Security Department and local public security agencies shall, under the unified deployment of the Provincial Party Committee, the Provincial Government, and the Provincial Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters, establish a working mechanism for the transportation of emergency supplies and professional medical personnel, and specify designated personnel to be responsible for docking and coordination.
If vehicles transporting emergency supplies and professional medical personnel needed coordination into Hubei, they could call the police service to be coordinated by the Provincial Public Security Transportation Administration. For transportation protection in the Wuhan City involving multiple police departments, the Wuhan Municipal Public Security Bureau Command Center would coordinate.
Local public security agencies must provide all-round traffic protection services for materials and professional and technical personnel vehicles passing by, and shall not block or lien on the grounds of road traffic control. For particular important emergency protection materials like medical equipment, police vehicles must be arranged to provide guidance.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: The public security departments must support and guarantee material and medical personnel transportation
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

For new applications for subsistence allowances and other social assistance, the departments could optimize and simplify review and approval procedures as appropriate, and extend the time limit for household verification. description: On February 7, 2020, the Jiangsu Department of Justice issued a notice on strengthening the legitimacy review that proposed five measures to strengthen the legitimacy review of documents and policies issued by local governments throughout the epidemic. Local judicial administrative departments should review related government documents, notices, and decisions according to laws and regulations, conduct in-depth and systematic research on laws, regulations, and policy documents related to epidemic prevention and control, and comprehend the original ideas behind the laws and regulations on epidemic prevention and control to avoid making illegal decisions or issuing documents that appear to be legitimate. They should enhance coordination, make full use of online review, joint review and other methods, and shorten the period of case review and settlement in accordance with the law. Related departments should keep up to date with current events, analyze law-related issues and complaints arising in the process of epidemic prevention and control, and give feedback. They should enhance information collection and online information analysis, conduct systematic and in-depth analysis and research on the economic and social risks caused by the epidemic, and report to the Party Committee and the government on the potential problems and legal risks reflected by the epidemic prevention and control in a timely manner.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: The policy calls for the strengthening of the legitimacy review for policies passed by local governments during the epidemic.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The "Fujian Health Code" service has been launched on February 14, 2020.  The Health Code is a national health care service mark for residents promoted and implemented by the state. It collects data such as residents' electronic health records, inpatient and outpatient records, and medication purchase records. Based on the health code, the Fujian Digital Office generates the "Bamin Health Code" in real time by docking and checking with the personnel information database of Hubei (Wuhan) and other epidemic-prone areas in Fujian, the national database of confirmed and suspected cases, the national database of close contacts, as well as the relevant basic databases of Fujian Provincial Health Planning, Health and Family Planning, and Public Security through the Fujian Health Planning Commission APP.

description:
The local government of Hancheng, China's Shaanxi Province announced on 13 July 2021 a ban on unvaccinated people entering key public places including supermarkets, hotels, restaurants, public vehicles and entertainment venues and government halls. Persons with a certificate that shows they are not suitable to receive COVID-19 vaccines are excluded from the ban.
According to a notice published by the city government on its offi cial WeChat account, the prohibition will start on Tuesday in some areas and on Thursday(15 July 2021) in the whole city. 

The key public places that local residents need to undergo checks include shopping malls, supermarkets, hotels, restaurants, public vehicles, entertainment venues, stadiums, hospitals, nursing homes, religious places and government halls.

description:
On January 21, Hubei announced that the epidemic report should be managed locally. When the military, armed police, factories, mining enterprises, schools, or other departments and their affiliated medical and health care discovers an epidemic, it must report it to the local disease prevention and control agency as required. 
The staff of various retail pharmacies and individual clinics shall inquire carefully and understand the relevant situation for those who come to buy medicines for fever and cough, and urge patients to go to the hospital in time. When finding cases or suspected cases of pneumonia infected by the new coronavirus, they must report them to the local disease prevention and control agency in the fastest way.
Governmental districts and departments should encourage the public to supervise the pneumonia epidemic caused by the new type of coronavirus. Those who are involved should promptly report to the local disease prevention and control agency or designated department.

description:
On March 1st, 2020, China published guidelines for people who recovered from COVID. 
After discharge, recovery of mildly ill patients mainly focuses on restoration of physical fitness and psychological adjustment, and progressive aerobic training can be selected according to the patient's past exercise habits and hobbies to gradually return to the activity capacity before the disease onset.
After severe patients meet the discharge criteria, a few of them may still have general weakness, shortness of breath, respiratory muscle weakness and muscle atrophy as well as some psychological problems for a period of time. They are first evaluated for cardiopulmonary and systemic function, and a personalized rehabilitation program is designed in cooperation with relevant specialists.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People who have recovered and/or survived COVID-19

description:
On 2020 May 12th, China, Guangxi Provincial Government, published a document with more specific guidance on the pandemic mask-wearing regulations after the spread has been controlled and the province has been downgraded to low risk for weeks. 

The new regulations still require mask-wearing in closed crowded areas such as public transportation and other places where the mass gathering is taking place. All personals are still required to wear masks in the hospital. Workers dealing directly with food or people are also required to wear masks whiling working. People with any covid symptoms are required to wear masks as well.

However, besides the previous requirements, people will not need to wear masks in inside space where social distancing (1 meter away) can be ensured. Outside mask-wearing is no longer required. School teachers and students will not be required to wear masks during lectures. Students located in low-risk areas will not be required to wear masks in school.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

Avoid unprotected contact with animals (especially wild animals), poultry or their feces, and eliminate the habit of indiscriminate consumption of wild animals.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that:

7. All schools, kindergartens, and training institutions should strengthen their promotion and education to teachers and students on epidemic prevention and control and remind them to practise personal preventive measures.

10. All people should adhere to good hygiene habits, such as wearing a mask (especially when taking public transportation and in public venues), washing hands frequently, maintaining regular ventilation, avoiding gatherings, maintaining one-metre social distancing, using serving chopsticks, and dividing meals. They should reduce visiting relatives and friends, and avoid gathering and going to crowded places. If they have symptoms such as fever, cough, diarrhea, and fatigue, they should wear a mask appropriately, go to the nearest medical institution immediately for diagnosis and treatment, and avoid taking public transportation for medical visits when possible.

The key points of standardized management of medical waste in medical institutions, including process formulation, personnel training, system implementation, supervision and management

description:

2. All townships, departments, enterprises and public institutions should continue to strengthen the requirements of grid management and control, and do a good job in the investigation, registration and control of personnel from Nanchang City of Jiangxi Province and those who come back to our county via Nanchang Railway Station since March 15. Hotels, hotels, rental rooms, home stay, Internet cafes, bath and other places to strictly implement the registration system, such as found special cases immediately report.
3. The general public is not required to go to Nanchang City of Jiangxi Province in the near future. If they must go, they must take good personal protection, report to their work unit and community (village or village) "immediately" after returning, and implement relevant requirements for epidemic prevention and control.

description:

Some details:

At present, the annual new coronavirus vaccination work is being carried out in an orderly manner. Till April 10, a total of 164.471 million doses of new coronavirus vaccine have been transplanted in various places, and the total number of doses of transplantation is the second in the world.

Building the educational vaccination protection system around the whole country's schools and colleges.

Two important focusing groups of people and areas, first one is important ports and cities, The second is the key population, including cold chain practitioners, medical and health personnel, personnel of government agencies, enterprises and institutions, college students and faculty, service personnel of large-scale supermarkets, and relevant personnel of transportation, logistics, and welfare institutions that guarantee the operation of the society.

description: On January 21, Hubei announced that suspected cases, confirmed cases, close contacts, and suspected exposures of new coronavirus infection should be put into quarantine. The confirmed cases shall be treated in isolation, and those who meet the discharge standards according to the relevant diagnosis and treatment plan shall be allowed to be discharged and lifted from isolation. Conduct medical observation in hospital isolation for suspected cases, and carry out laboratory investigations as soon as possible; if the new coronavirus infection is excluded by laboratory diagnosis, their quarantine can be lifted. Close contacts and suspected exposed persons shall be subject to medical observation at home or in centralized isolation, and the observation period shall be 14 days after the last contact with a case without effective protection or after a suspected exposure. During the medical observation period, if there is no fever (underarm body temperature ≥37.3°C), cough, shortness of breath and other symptoms of acute respiratory infection, the medical observation can be terminated after 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

Close contacts and suspected exposed persons shall be subject to medical observation at home or in centralized isolation, and the observation period shall be 14 days after the last contact with a case without effective protection or after a suspected exposure. description:
On March 2nd, 2020, based on the three-level response regulation, the government of Sichuan implements the new quarantine rules in high-risk areas. 

People from the high-risk areas:
(1) People travelling from the Coronavirus hotspots in Hubei should be subject to collective quarantine under medical observation for 14 days. (2) People travelling from the other the high-risk areas should be either subject to collective quarantine or under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (3) People travelling from the other overseas Coronavirus hotspots should be either subject to collective quarantine or be under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (4) Confirmed patients and people who display the Coronavirus symptoms can be only released after receiving treatments from proper medical institutions. (5) People who do not display the Coronavirus symptoms should be under medical observation for 14 days and have negative results of nucleic tests twice consecutively (intervals of tests should be at least one day).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

If the requirements above cannot be met, self-isolation at home with health observation is acceptable.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 15 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that:

1. All travellers entering Inner Mongolia must be quarantined for 14 days upon their arrival. And they must pay for all the expenses incurred during the centralised isolation and medical observation.

2. Those who have not undergone centralised isolation and medical observation within the 14 days must immediately report to the local community (Gacha Village), which will then be responsible for implementing the measures.

3. Those who refuse to abide by the epidemic prevention and control measures will be investigated and held accountable by law.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Hainan, China, April 2nd, 2020
The government’s order that everybody who enters the border of Hainan must be sent to a concentrated observation institution for a 14-day long medical quarantine observation. Everybody must take a  Nucleic Acid Amplification Technique(Covid-19 test) on the day they enter the border and on the 13th day of the quarantine. For people who are asymptomatic carriers, it is mandatory for them to quarantine in the hospital for 14 days, they will be sent to a concentrated observation institution for another 14-day quarantine after the quarantine in the hospital, and if they were tested negative twice from Nucleic Acid Amplification Technique(Covid-19 test).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On March 17, the Hainan Provincial Headquarters for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Epidemic issued the "Notice on Orderly Repatriation of People Stranded in Hubei in Our Province". According to the relevant regulations of Hubei Province, the following notices are made on the matters related to the return of Hainan residents stranded in Hubei (excluding Wuhan):

1. Those who have a history of residence in Hubei (excluding Wuhan) within 14 days can apply for returning to Hainan to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee in Hainan by telephone, email, fax, etc. in advance.

 2. The personnel returning to Hainan in Hubei shall apply to the county-level pass certificate or health monitoring certificate, he must use "point-to-point, one-stop" chartered flights, chartered vehicles or self-driving methods to return to Hainan in a precise, safe and orderly manner.

3. After arriving at the destination, people returning from Hubei to Qiong should immediately report to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee for registration, and strictly implement 14-day self-home isolation measures.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
To earnestly respond to the secondary response requirements for public health emergencies in Henan Province and improve the economic and social operation methods compatible with epidemic prevention and control, the Municipal Epidemic Prevention Work Leading Group decided to strengthen the prevention and control of the epidemic. Further, take the following measures:

1. Prevent imported overseas epidemics more precisely

Earnestly implement the central government’s “perfect data sharing, information notification, and entry-exit personnel verification mechanism,” establish special prevention and control work teams for the three hubs of airports, high-speed railways, and railway stations, strictly implement “dual-code scanning,” and measure body temperature. Relocation, transshipment, isolation, and other measures have further strengthened the control of people entering Zhengzhou from abroad.

2. Centralized quarantine of people entering Zheng from abroad

From March 20, 2020, the Zhengzhou New Crown Pneumonia Epidemic Prevention and Control Leading Group will implement centralized isolation and implement medical observation recommendations for residents from abroad in Zhengzhou at their own expense. Older people over 70 years old, minors, pregnant women, and immigrants with special circumstances (such as serious basic diseases) can apply for family quarantine. After strict evaluation by the county (city, district), the village (resident) will implement 14 isolation measures at

description: April 3, 2020: The government of Guangxi province announced a set of quarantine policies targeting people entering Guangxi via the waterway, which stated for people belong to the "four categories" (confirmed cases, suspected cases, those with fever symptoms, and close contacts) will be promptly transferred to designated places for treatment or undergo 14 days of centralized quarantine and medical observation; for foreign crew members (except for diplomatic personnel and those engaged in important economic, trade, scientific and technological cooperation), 14 days of centralized quarantine will be implemented; for Chinese crew members entering the country, if they have been at sea for more than 14 days before arriving and are in good health, and have been cleared by the customs health and quarantine department, they are allowed to disembark. If they have not been at sea for 14 days but meet the same requirements, they will be allowed to disembark and undergo 14 days of centralized quarantine and medical observation, to complete the required 14-day quarantine period, by the district or city government where the port of entry is located. And all the costs associated with the centralized quarantine should be handled by the individuals themselves.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On April 20, 2020, China, Guangxi Provincial Health Department requires all arrivals to be quarantined for 28 days. Afterall arrivals, people will be required to stay in the designated inspection point and be quarantined for 14 days for medical inspection. After 14 days of medical inspection, arriving personal will be asked to follow the stay home order for another 14 days. Meanwhile, two COVID testings and one antibody testing are required. Arrivals from high infected areas, which include but not limited to Heilongjiang Province, Neimenggu Province, Liaoning Province, Guangdong Province, and Beijing Province, will need to present a negative COVID test result within a week and healthy self-reporting report history or will be denied to enter.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
From 24 April 2020, Inner Mongolia is implementing a two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations classified as “middle-risk and high-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province;  Baiyun district and Yuexiu district in Guangdong province; Beijing’s Chaoyang District (adjusted according to the situation dynamically ). They enter Inner Mongolia will be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.

From 12 am on 10 May 2020, Inner Mongolia cancels the two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations where already adjusted from “medium-risk and high-risk zones” to “low-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province. They enter Inner Mongolia will not be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries

description: Authorities announced increased entry restrictions in Urumqi, the capital of Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, on Thursday, July 30, due to a continued increase of locally detected cases of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19). Non-residents planning to depart the city will need to test negative for COVID-19 in nucleic acid and antibody tests if they have been in Urumqi for 14 days or more. Those arriving in the city will also be required to undertake a 14-day quarantine if arriving from an area deemed as high risk for COVID-19 transmission. Those arriving from other areas will need to prove that they have tested negative for COVID-19 within the past seven days and may be subject to other restrictions depending on their point of departure. Authorities have requested that residents avoid unnecessary travel outside of Urumqi.

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Tongliao City is enforcing a two-week quarantine on people who ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant" between 12:30 pm and 13:50 pm on August 25, 2020. Because on August 25, five close contacts of COVID-19 from other provinces had transferred trains in Tongliao City. During the period from 12:30 pm to 13:50 pm, they ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant". description: On October 25, 2020, Hohhot, Inner Mongolia requires people travelled from Shufu County, Kashgar, Xinjiang since October 10 have entered Hohhot must actively declare to the community (village), unit, and the hotel where they live. If people can not provide a negative nucleic acid test certificate, they must accept centralized quarantine as soon as possible and undergo a nucleic acid test. They can flow in an orderly manner after the nucleic acid test result is negative. Once a person with a positive nucleic acid test result is found, he shall be immediately transferred by the local disease control department to a designated medical institution for receiving treatment in isolation. If people hold a negative certificate of the nucleic acid test within 7 days when they enter Hohhot city, they can move freely and orderly under the premise of normal body temperature and effective personal protection.

type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

They can move freely and orderly under the premise of normal body temperature and effective personal protection. If people are unable to provide a negative result of nucleic acid test information or have not yet undergone the nucleic acid test, they must conduct centralised quarantine and nucleic acid testing immediately. description: Authorities in China have slightly relaxed some movement and transport controls meant to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease  COVID-19 . The government continues to ban nonessential travel from high-risk areas; however, most nonessential businesses within designated communities have reopened. Officials define 31 communities in Shijiazhuang, one community in Xingtai, and one community in Langfang as medium risk. description:
On May 30, 2021, Hohhot Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that after May 15, 2021 (include May 15), people who travelled from Baihedong Street, Zhongnan Street, Dongnao Street, Chongkou Street, Liwan District and Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province as well as Huafu Yushui'an Community, Guicheng Street, Nanhai District, Foshan City, who hold a certificate of nucleic acid test negative result issued within 7 days, they can flow in an orderly manner under the premise of normal temperature measurement and personal protection. 

If the nucleic acid test negative results cannot be provided, a centralized quarantine shall be conducted at the first city entry point and the nucleic acid test shall be completed within 24 hours. People can be released from quarantine after the test result is negative. The local disease control department will immediately send a person with a positive test result to the designated medical institution for isolation and treatment in accordance with the regulatory requirements.

description:
On May 20th 2020, Pu Yang government announced that all people traveling from medium/high-risk areas in China entering Pu Yang since May 8th will be required to take 14 days of quarantine and 2 COVID test. UPDATE: Beginning May 30th, new personnel traveling from Beijing entering Pu Yang must be quarantined for 14 days, and PCR and serum tests must be carried out twice during quarantine. This policy includes those who have returned to Pu within 14 days after May 30th. After 14 days of centralized quarantine, the community must take a follow-up 14 days of health monitoring. 
For those who have lived in non-medium-risk/non-high-risk areas in Beijing since May 30, after passing PCR and serological tests with 14 days of quarantine, additional 14 days of self-quarantine are strongly recommended.

description:
On January 28, 2020, the Local Financial Supervision Administration of Hubei ordered financial institutions to urge their personnel to raise awareness of scientific prevention and control, to learn and master prevention knowledge and measures, and to rationally view the development, prevention, and control of the epidemic. 
The units must seriously conduct in-store disinfection and fully grasp the whereabouts of their personnel. They must establish a daily report and investigation system with specified implementation personnel and urge all personnel to report every day. If personnel or their family members had confirmed or suspected cases of the novel coronavirus infected pneumonia, the units must promptly report to local disease prevention and control agencies and urge the infected to see a doctor or take corresponding quarantine measures.

description:
On January 28, 2020, the Hubei Provincial Grain Bureau ordered all kinds of grain and oil enterprises in the province to increase consciously grain and oil production and supply, strengthen overall planning, and try to connect effectively grain and oil processing, storage, transportation, distribution, and supply to maintain a smooth operation of all links, ensuring that grain and oil supply would not be out of stock, and increasing the market’s ability to react in emergency and distribution capabilities. 

The enterprises should cooperate with government regulation, patiently and meticulously publicize and explain to consumers information based on facts, such as sufficient grain and oil stocks, ample market supply, and perfect grain reserve emergency system, and guide consumers to buy grain nearby and rationally, and avoid queuing up and panic buying.

The enterprises should also do proper and safe disinfection of on-the-job personnel and the work site, strictly require them to wear protective equipment to work, and strengthen temperature measurement and inspection. The enterprises should arrange properly the working and boarding of employees during holidays, and care about their health. They should improve the emergency plan for epidemic prevention and control and deal with problems found according to relevant requirements in time.

The department prohibited all real estate development companies from holding on-site centralized sales promotion and other activities, and suggested them to make full use of information technology such as WeChat, video, and the Internet to promote relevant information. The department also prohibited all real estate agencies from holding large-scale activities. The department also urged the relevant personnel of real estate companies and agencies to wear protective equipment such as masks and to do their own protection and disinfection.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 29 January 2020. General Office of Inner Mongolia announces that:

- For people who need to return to Inner Mongolia due to work, their local, relevant departments/units must report information of those who come from/have travelled to high-risk areas and their close contacts. They must also strictly follow the required measures, including health monitoring and isolation. 

- People who cannot return to Inner Mongolia due to the epidemic or work must promptly apply for leave and report their situation.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Contact tracing measures
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable),Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: On January 29, 2020, Alxa League Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that Alxa League temporarily cancelled shuttle bus service. From January 29, 2020, shuttle buses and chartered buses from Alxa League to outside the League and from outside the Alxa League to the League would be suspended. All shuttle bus service in Alxa League had been suspended.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 29 January 2020. General Office of Inner Mongolia announces that:

1. All businesses will resume no earlier than 9 February. Essential businesses (e.g., water supply, gas supply, heat supply, power supply, communications etc.), those necessary for epidemic prevention control (e.g., supermarkets, food production and supply), and those related to the national economy and people's livelihood are exempted. 

2. All businesses must protect their employees' legal rights and interests as per the law and, based on the epidemic, implement the required health check and protective measures to ensure the safe resumption of work.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_cat: Non-Essential Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
On January 31, 2020, Emergency Management Department of Hubei announced that all industrial, mining, and commercial enterprises in the province (except for those producing epidemic prevention and control materials) shall not resume work and production earlier than 24:00 on February 13, 2020. Districts should plan for resumption of work and production accordingly, and submit plans to the Safety Production Foundation Division of the Department before February 10, 2020.
All industrial, mining and commercial enterprises must establish an epidemic prevention and control leading group with the principal in charge. 
These enterprises should strengthen the security guards and protection of factory (mining) areas, and be equipped with infrared thermometers, masks, disinfectants, etc. as necessary. They must strictly observe people who had contact with key areas of the epidemic; isolate people who had symptoms such as fever and those they had contact with, and report promptly.
The enterprises must reinforce education and training of epidemic prevention and control policies and measures, and safety production and emergency management knowledge for main persons in charge, safety management personnel and special operation personnel through self-teaching, online videos, etc.
The enterprises must investigate hidden dangers of key parts and equipment.
Enterprises that did not fulfill rules above must not resume work. Those in severe violations would be in the safety production "blacklist."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_cat: Non-Essential Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Hygiene and sanitation measures required,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry),Temperature Check,Other condition not specified above (please provide detail in the text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 31, 2020, Alxa League Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that enterprises must not resume work and must not require employees to return to work before 24 o'clock on February 9, 2020. Except for enterprises were involved in ensuring the operation of the city (water supply, gas supply, power supply, communications, etc.), epidemic prevention and control (medical equipment, medicines, protective equipment production and sales, etc.), people’s daily necessities (supermarkets, farmers’ markets, food production and logistics supply, etc. ) and other enterprises related to the important national economy and people's livelihood. Enterprises that had not stopped production and operations were not allowed to recall employees outside Alxa League in advance.

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Hohhot Prefecture, Saihan District; 2 February 2020. Canteens should consider meal distribution and delivery or encourage workers to eat at home.

description: On February 2, 2020, the Fujian Provincial Department of Civil Affairs formulated the "Fujian Province issued a notice on further improving the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic in elderly institutions and children's welfare institutions" clearly requires that during the prevention and control of the epidemic, children's welfare institutions should be fully closed management. Children's welfare structures to suspend the admission of new children, suspend the reception of outsiders to visit condolences, visits to consult, visits; suspend all volunteer services and social practice activities; except for the treatment of major diseases.

description:
Opinions of the General Office of Shandong Provincial People's Government on Supporting the Stable and Healthy Development of Small and Medium Enterprises in Response to the New Covid-19 pandemic.
In order to thoroughly implement the important instruction of General Secretary Xi Jinping on resolutely winning the battle against the epidemic, fully implement the decision and deployment of the Party Central Committee and the State Council on the prevention and control of the epidemic, support small and medium-sized enterprises to actively cope with the impact of the epidemic and achieve stable and healthy development, with the consent of the provincial Party committee and the provincial government, the following opinions are put forward:
1. Strengthen financial support.
2. Reduce the burden of taxes and fees.
3. Reduce operating costs.
4. Increase efforts to stabilize employment.
The above policy measures are applicable to the small and medium-sized enterprises identified by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and other four departments issuing the "Regulations on the Standard for the Classification of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises" (Ministry of Industry and Information Technology Joint Enterprise [2011] No. 300), which shall be implemented from the date of issuance and shall be valid for a temporary period of three months.

General Office of the People's Government of Shandong Province
February 4, 2020

description:
The General Office of Shandong Provincial People's Government issued a notice on actively responding to the COVID-19 epidemic and speeding up the recovery of agricultural production to ensure important agricultural products.

In order to effectively respond to the adverse impact of the new pneumonia epidemic, resume agricultural production in the province as soon as possible, press the "vegetable basket" mayor to take charge of the system and ensure the supply of important agricultural products in the market, the following measures are formulated. 

1. Accelerate the construction of agricultural enterprises and the stable resumption of agricultural production 


2. strengthen the effective docking of production and marketing, expand the sale of agricultural products 


3. orderly break the traffic obstruction, smooth the flow of people and logistics in urban and rural areas 

4. Coordinate the use of agricultural-related funds and increase financial and taxation support 

5. Create precise preferential policies and improve financial services 

6. Strengthen the organization and leadership, and consolidate local responsibilities

General Office of the People's Government of Shandong Province

11 February 2020

description:
On Feb 19th, 2020, the Henan Provincial People's Government issued the new crown pneumonia epidemic for enterprises to resume work and production for Luoyang city. The requirement includes:
1. Establish a mechanism (e.g. develop a prevention and control plan)
2. health monitoring of all employees, set up temporary isolation points; employees who have a history of living in other areas with severe epidemics and who have had a history of close contact with confirmed or suspected cases will be subject to centralized isolation or home medical observation for 14 days
3. Preparation for COVID protection (sanitization, Keeping windows open for 30 minutes at least twice a day in the workplace, etc)

description:
Henan, China issued a series of policies regarding to reopening non-coal mining industry on Feb 17. For example,
Companies should follow the regulations of coronavirus prevention and control. They should prepare and submit a proposal for epidemic prevention and control.
Employees must come back to work in turn and implement health testing and self-quarantine.
Employees must wear masks when entering the workplace.
Workplace should be disinfected regularly.
Cases must be reported to local departments.

description: On March 3, 2020, the Transportation Department of Liaoning Province announced 30 Items for port and ship companies in Liaoning to prevent and control the epidemic. As for port companies, ships operating at ports in severely epidemic areas abroad are limited with some conditions. For the ships, the crew members on ship are not allowed to change or disembark unless there are special circumstances. For the boarding operators on land, their number should be strictly restricted, they should keep a safe distance from the crew and not enter the crew’s living area and they should obey the rules of health testing, health monitoring, and wearing protective equipment, including masks, gloves, protective clothing and goggles.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 3, 2020, the Transportation Department of Liaoning Province announced 30 Items for port and ship companies in Liaoning to prevent and control the epidemic. As for ship companies, their crew members should be under health monitoring by the company and they are not allowed to go ashore when the ship is boarding at ports in severely epidemic areas overseas. Operators and port passenger terminals of waterway passenger transport routes from Liaoning province to severely epidemic areas overseas are suspended to carry out international passenger transport services, and ship companies should apply to the Department of Pandemic Prevention and Control of Liaoning Province 24 hours before reopening the services for unlocks.

description: On March 14, 2020, the Hubei Sanitation and Health Committee Vice-Chairperson Liu Dongru announces that only Wuhan remains a high-risk area, and that the rest of the provinces are considered medium or low-risk areas. These low-risk areas could lift their blockades and other mobility controls. By March 14, the cities of Yichang, Huanggang, Suizhou, Xiantao, Jingzhou, Jingmen, Shiyan, Xiangyang, Tianmen and Shennongjia had announced measures to lessen controls and for industries to resume work and production gradually.
