description:
On March 15 2020, Xinjiang published guidelines for the management measures of shopping malls and supermarkets. These include:

- Hygiene and cleaning measures
- Setting key areas for health checking, waste management, emergency isolation
- Temperature checks for all staff and customers
- Mask wearing for staff and customers
- Social distancing and restricting contact on elevators and in lifts.

description:
China's Hunan Province unveiled plans to shut down their exotic food industry at the end of April 2020. The plan included a financial compensation of 120 Yuan to farmers per kilogram of snake and 75 Yuan per kilogram of bamboo rat. A fixed compensation was offered for other animals such as porcupine, civets, wild goose and more. 

Existing stocks were to be released to nature or used for purposes other than for food or to burn or burry them.

description: On July 19, 2020, Fujian Province announced that cinemas could resume opening on July 20. description: On Sep 11th, 2020, to ensure the orderly implementation of the epidemic prevention and control of large-scale events and gatherings, Henan requires the organizers to be equipped with COVID prevention and control. Control the team. The event organizer should prepare an epidemic prevention and control team consisting of professional technicians, cleaning personnel, security personnel, volunteers, etc.; Drop-off point, temperature measurement point, temporary isolation point, medical point, etc. The notification requires that after the event, the organizer should still carry out related work, such as cleaning and disinfecting the event site, removing and transporting garbage, and continuing to monitor the health of relevant personnel.

description: China, Inner Mongolia; 30 December 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several measures required to be implemented during the New Year and Spring Festival. Measures target retail businesses (e.g., shopping malls, supermarkets, farmers' markets, wholesale markets, cinemas, theatres, Internet cafes, bars, restaurants, hotels), airports, railway, and subway stations. These venues should reinforce policies and measures such as crowd control, temperature checks at entry, mask-wearing, checking of "health code", and disinfection in public areas.

description: On January 22nd, 2021, Hebei, China published a guide for COVID-19 prevention and control at construction sites. The "Guide" requires that an epidemic prevention and control organization be established by the project leader at the construction site, equipped with adequate medical protective masks, protective clothing, goggles, disposable gloves, disinfectant alcohol, and disinfectant that meet national and industry standards. , Anti-epidemic materials such as intelligent body temperature detection equipment, and reliable supply channels. Real-name management is implemented for the entry personnel. The entry personnel must hold a health code and have a negative nucleic acid test before entering the construction site. After entering the construction site, the nucleic acid test should be performed in a timely manner according to the situation. All management personnel and migrant workers who enter the construction area, office area, and living area, including service personnel such as security guards, cleaning, canteens, etc., must wear masks, and the changed masks must be properly handled. Except for procurement personnel, material supply vehicles and personnel (the two categories of personnel should also check the health code and temperature measurement registration), all other personnel are not allowed to enter the site, and personnel at the entrance and exit shall be on duty 24 hours a day.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential
institution_status: This type of business  ("Construction") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
On January 28, the Henan Provincial Culture and Tourism Department announced specific guidelines for the tourism market on epidemics prevention and control during the Spring Festival of 2021. 
In principle, no large-scale events should be held during the Spring Festival period. Otherwise, it must be strictly approved based on careful evaluation. The number of audiences in theatres and other performance venues shall not exceed 75% of the theatre's seating capacity. For venues containing multiple theatre rooms, measures shall be implemented so the audiences can enter and exit through different routes and times to avoid large-scale gatherings. For all types of entertainment venues, the number of customers allowed for entrance shall not exceed 75% of the regular allowance. 
For travel agencies, safety risk assessments on tourism routes must be carefully conducted. It is strictly forbidden to organize travel to medium- and high-risk areas. Local administrative departments should urge travel agencies to implement the "one group, one report" system -- filling in travel information and uploading the electronic contracts on the national tourism supervision service platform for inspection. 
Star-rated should implement the epidemic prevention and control measures such as regular nucleic acid testing on imported cold-chain food and workers, disinfecting public supplies and appliances and widening the distance between tables.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
institution_cat: Non-Essential Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Hygiene and sanitation measures required
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces measures to prevent and control the epidemic during Spring Festival:

3. All party/government organisations and enterprises should not hold large-scale gatherings/conferences and instead organise online meetings. If having a conference with more than 50 people, the host should formulate and implement a prevention and control plan under the guidance of the local Command Centre. They should also cancel group worship and condolences, gatherings, dinners, training etc.

6. Retail pharmacies must implement the real-name registration when selling antipyretic, antitussive, antiviral, antibiotics and other drugs. If a patient is experiencing fever or cough symptoms, they should report to the local community health centre within 2 hours.

8. The total visitor capacity of all tourist attractions, theatres, Internet cafes, and singing and dancing entertainment venues shall not exceed 75%. The number of people in closed places such as bathrooms and bathhouses should not be over 50% of the capacity limit.

9. For shopping malls, supermarkets, catering venues and accommodation, farmers' markets, cultural and entertainment venues, and public transport (airports, railway stations, subways, and bus stations), measures such as crowd control, ventilation, disinfection and sanitation, temperature checks, mask-wearing, and checking of the "health code" must be reinforced.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces measures to prevent and control the epidemic during Spring Festival:

3. All party/government organisations and enterprises should not hold large-scale gatherings/conferences and instead organise online meetings. If having a conference with more than 50 people, the host should formulate and implement a prevention and control plan under the guidance of the local Command Centre. They should also cancel group worship and condolences, gatherings, dinners, training etc.

6. Retail pharmacies must implement the real-name registration when selling antipyretic, antitussive, antiviral, antibiotics and other drugs. If a patient is experiencing fever or cough symptoms, they should report to the local community health centre within 2 hours.

8. The total visitor capacity of all tourist attractions, theatres, Internet cafes, and singing and dancing entertainment venues shall not exceed 75%. The number of people in closed places such as bathrooms and bathhouses should not be over 50% of the capacity limit.

9. For shopping malls, supermarkets, catering venues and accommodation, farmers' markets, cultural and entertainment venues, and public transport (airports, railway stations, subways, and bus stations), measures such as crowd control, ventilation, disinfection and sanitation, temperature checks, mask-wearing, and checking of the "health code" must be reinforced.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_cat: Non-Essential Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Contact tracing measures
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hinggan League, Horqin Right Middle Banner; 12 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several vaccination policies.

All staff/party members of the party and government enterprises and institutions, unless contraindicated, must be vaccinated by 25 July. All owners/operators of the industrial and trading enterprises or public service industries must assume the responsibility to ensure their eligible employees are vaccinated by the due date. Those who have not achieved full vaccination of staff will be regulated by the industry’s regulatory department.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hinggan League, Horqin Right Middle Banner; 12 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several vaccination policies.

Starting from 15 July, In addition to the existing infection prevention and control measures and Health Code and Travel History Code check, proof of vaccination will also be required for using public transport/taxi services and visiting densely populated venues. The requirement applies to medical institutions, stations, aged care facilities, nursing homes, welfare facilities, prisons, hostels, hotels, public baths, hair salons, shopping malls, supermarkets, banks, farmers' markets, tourist attractions, cinemas, karaoke bars, internet cafes, game halls, gyms, and offices.

The venue operators/drivers are also required to register unvaccinated patrons'/passengers' details, such as their name, ID number, residential address, and phone number, and immediately report to the industry's regulatory department. The department should report hereafter to the medical team of the local Command Centre.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer Prefecture, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 prevention and control announces that starting from 15 July, in addition to continuing the current infection prevention and control measures and checking patrons' health code and travel history code: 

Proof of vaccination will be required for taking public transport and entering densely populated venues, including medical institutions, aged care facilities, pharmacies, hotels, shopping malls, supermarkets, farmers' markets, tourist attractions, bookstores, libraries, Internet cafes, KTV, cinemas, gyms, gas stations, banks, and offices of, e.g., insurance, communications, and water (electricity, gas) supply companies.

The venues are also required to register the details of those who are not vaccinated, recording information such as their name, ID number, occupation, residential address, phone number, etc. They should then immediately report to the industry's regulatory department. The department should report hereafter to the medical team of the local Command Centre for COVID-19 prevention and control.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer Prefecture, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control recommends that starting from 25 July, densely-populated venues, including shopping malls, supermarkets, hostels, hotels, movie theatres, etc., refer to the control measures for other businesses and government services. Measures that can be referred to include suspending unvaccinated people from entering the venue.
 
In addition, service industries such as tourist attractions, movie theatres, hostels, hotels, supermarkets, catering venues, and telecommunication operations can introduce vouchers and discount programs for vaccinated people.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 August 2021. Inner Mongolia Culture and Tourism Department announces that:

Travel agencies and online travel companies must not organise tours to high-risk areas, accept tour groups from high-risk areas, or organise trips for tourists from high-risk areas.

If the destination government issues a travel warning notice or declares the destination as a medium- or high-risk area, tours that have not departed must immediately cancel or change the travel itinerary. Tour groups that have arrived at the destination must suspend their tourism activities and cooperate with the required epidemic investigation procedures.

All regions must continue strengthening their supervision of the travel industry and urge local travel agencies and online travel companies to follow relevant guidelines and implement epidemic prevention and control. According to the guidelines, they should also assume the primary responsibility of implementing all the required measures.

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered the Housing and Construction Departments of all levels to strengthen the safety protection of environmental sanitation operators and front-line law enforcement team members. All front-line personnel must take safe and effective protective measures during the epidemic prevention and control period. All units must distribute masks, gloves, and other protective equipment in full to prevent infection of workers. The departments must organize training and guidance for sanitation and cleaning personnel, teach them correct protection methods, and prevent cross-infection due to lack of protection. The departments must reasonably arrange work and rest, scientifically control labor intensity, and prevent problems such as excessive fatigue.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to strengthen the self-protection of staff. The staff must wear work clothes and masks, wash hands frequently, and develop good hygiene during work. They must wash and disinfect their hands before serving and feeding children. When the staff accompany children to the hospital, they must take various protective measures. During the work period, the institutions must check on all staff regularly. If they had fever, cough and other suspected symptoms, the institutions must put them under quarantine, send them to medical treatment in time, and report relevant information.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered funeral homes to strengthen the protective measures for funeral workers. They should equip funeral service personnel with masks, disinfectants, thermometers and other necessary protective equipment, and staff who came into contact with the remains of patients with new pneumonia (including suspected patients) should implement the most stringent protective measures. They should reinforce the epidemic prevention and control of key areas such as the business halls, service negotiation rooms, and ash collection areas, set up special reception desks, allow no more than 2 family members to handle the business at a time, and adopt methods such as wearing masks, measuring body temperature, washing and disinfecting hands, reinforcing the safety and protection of front-line workers. The funeral homes must strictly disinfect all workplaces and ventilate facilities to eliminate all hidden dangers that may spread the virus.

After the resumption of the market, they must implement the epidemic prevention and control requirements for business sites strictly. They must open windows regularly for ventilation, regular cleaning, and disinfection of welfare lottery sales agencies and various operations, maintaining environmental sanitation. Before the epidemic ended, staff and sales personnel should wear masks and other protective equipment to work. Lottery ticket buyers entering sales agencies or operations should wear masks as requested.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to maintain hygiene in children’s living environment and food. They should open windows of children’s living areas and activity rooms regularly every day for ventilation to maintain indoor air circulation, wipe and disinfect children’s bed rails, toys, tables and chairs regularly, and record the wiping and disinfection work. They should regularly carry out children's temperature monitoring, restrict children from drinking unboiled water or eating raw or cold food, avoid their sharing of water cups, tableware, towels, toothbrushes and other items, let them thoroughly clean hands with running water before and after meals, to develop good hygiene habits.

They should reinforce sanitation and cleaning, change and wash clothes and quilts in time, open windows regularly for ventilation, conduct regular site disinfection, maintain environmental sanitation of the institution, and ensure the safety of medication and catering.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should advise families of the deceased not to hold farewell ceremonies. After receiving a telephone appointment, the funeral homes must properly transport the remains, and advise the families of the deceased to reduce the number of people attending funerals and not to hold farewell ceremonies. If the family members still insisted on holding farewell ceremonies, the funeral homes must strictly control the scale of attendance and take corresponding prevention and control measures.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to apply to establish a fast and convenient medical channel for personnel of civil service agencies. The departments should implement the "two teams on duty simultaneously" and "report even with zero cases" systems. All localities and units must develop an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strictly conduct regular duty on holiday and duty for emergency epidemic prevention, and strictly implement the mechanism of leadership on duty, 24-hour duty on important positions, and the information reporting system.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Higher People's Court of Hubei announced that during the epidemic prevention and control period, litigation service centers of courts at all levels in the province would be closed and not take in case applications. For people intending to file a case in court, the Court recommended them to do so online through channels such as Hubei Court Litigation Service (http://www.hbfy.org/electronic court section), Hubei Mobile WeChat Court (adding the WeChat Miniprogram via mobile phone). For those finding online filing inconvenient, the Court recommended them to mail their application materials to the relevant court.

description: On Jan. 29, 2020, according to the work requirements of the port traffic group of the Department of Pandemic and Control of Liaoning Province, 150 toll stations would be temporarily closed on some expressways in Liaoning province from 0:00 on January 30 (vehicles for transporting prevention and control materials and Rescue vehicles can pass normally); 33 service areas would be temporarily closed at 17:00 on January 29. The province reserved 143 toll stations and 40 service areas to open and operate.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 29 January 2020. General Office of Inner Mongolia announces that: 

- All administrative units will resume on 3 February. On the basis that they can ensure the implementation of epidemic prevention and control and their normal operation, they will implement flexible working arrangements until 9 February. Employees can complete their job through mobile phones, the Internet, and video. All units are to stagger employees' start and finish times, minimise meetings and gatherings, and effectively control the number of attendees.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 29 January 2020. General Office of Inner Mongolia announces that:

- For people who need to return to Inner Mongolia due to work, their local, relevant departments/units must report information of those who come from/have travelled to high-risk areas and their close contacts. They must also strictly follow the required measures, including health monitoring and isolation. 

- People who cannot return to Inner Mongolia due to the epidemic or work must promptly apply for leave and report their situation.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should cremate the remains of patients with COVID-19 (including suspected patients) who died in the burial reform areas. For those died in counties (cities, districts) without cremation facilities, the municipal (prefecture) Civil Affairs department should report to the local epidemic prevention headquarters, and designate funeral parlors to send special vehicles to pick the remains up and conduct cremation nearby. All funeral homes shall set up special passages, special funeral vehicles, special cremation machines and isolation areas. After completing the relevant procedures such as death certificates, handover of the remains, and approval of cremation, the funeral homes should transport the deceased’s remains directly to the cremation room for cremation. During the handover of the remains, the funeral homes must confirm that medical and health institutions had carried out sanitation and epidemic prevention treatment.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to establish a temperature monitoring system for employees and staff after the holiday. The departments should strictly manage the entry and exit of outsiders, and all visitors shall register and measure their body temperature. For public spaces such as canteens, meeting rooms, and offices, the departments should carry out disinfection and opening windows for ventilation regularly. The departments should also simplify meetings, reduce personnel gathering, and arrange and carry out work through video and telephone conferences and work chat groups as much as possible.

If the staff had a history of contact with people diagnosed with COVID-19, they should consciously go into quarantine and observe; if they had suspected symptoms such as fever and cough, they should seek medical treatment in time and report to the local disease control department.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to implement temporary closed management. They should cancel all kinds of collective activities, decline all kinds of volunteer services, parties, and condolences; people outside the hospital who must enter for work must not come into contact with children in the children’s living area. The institutions must carefully register, do temperature measurement, disinfection, etc. on entering and exiting personnel, and those with fever might not enter. The institutions must cancel children’s collective play activities and avoid them going to densely populated public places. For cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus, the institutions should put them under quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, and report and assist in investigation.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels within the province to strengthen the protective measures for employees, and fully manage the movements and actions of personnel. The departments must effectively strengthen the responsibilities of emergency duty posts and strictly implement the 24-hour special-person on-duty and leadership-led shift system. The departments must strengthen information reporting and implement a “daily report” system for the outbreak of new coronavirus infection pneumonia.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to reinforce the self-protection of the staff. They should carry out epidemic prevention and control education for staff, properly monitor the body temperature of personnel entering and leaving the agencies, and implement a daily health report system for personnel. They should strengthen the contact and linkage mechanism with the health and epidemic prevention departments to ensure responding and handling problems in a timely manner. Without special circumstances, during the Spring Festival, the agencies should not send and pick up people served at the agencies.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to do proper prevention and control of the epidemic situation for inbound and on-site personnel. All rescue and management agencies shall open up emergency quarantine observation areas for epidemic prevention and control, equipped with infrared forehead thermometers and sanitary and epidemic prevention materials. They should ask new arrivals about their physical condition and temperature; transfer those found to have fever, fatigue, cough and other symptoms immediately to an independent observation area for observation or to a hospital for examination.

description: On January 30, 2020, the Financial Department of Hubei announced that, in principle, the gathering of personnel for on-site bid opening and bid evaluation of government procurement projects should be suspended or postponed. For government procurement projects affected by this, the purchaser or procurement agency shall issue a correction announcement in accordance with the laws, and notify the relevant suppliers and review experts through in-person calls, text messages or emails. If it was really necessary to carry out government procurement bid opening, bid evaluation and other activities due to work needs, under the principle of “responsibility following purchases,” the purchaser should perfect personnel registration and protection, site disinfection and ventilation and other protective measures to ensure that the health and safety of reviewers and relevant staff. When the emergency response to the epidemic in the province got terminated, normal procurement activities should resume without further notice.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

description: On January 30, 2020, Hubei's Department of Justice announced that during the epidemic prevention and control period, administrative reconsideration reception sites would be temporarily closed and stopped accepting applicants. The resumption time of reception would be determined by local departments depending on the changes in the epidemic. Applicants were encouraged to apply for administrative reconsideration by mail, and localities and departments where conditions permitted should accept administrative reconsideration application materials online. If the applicant really needed to submit an application for administrative reconsideration in person, they must comply with relevant regulations on epidemic prevention and control. In principle, administrative reconsideration would mainly be through written hearings, and no file reviews or hearing matters would be arranged for the time being.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

description: On January 30, 2020, Hubei Provincial Public Resources Transaction Supervision and Administration Bureau suspended on-site consultation and collection of complaints and reports on bidding, the bidding online complaint handling system "Hubei Provincial Bidding Electronic Supervision Platform" together with the Hubei Provincial Electronic Bidding Trading Platform, and all investigations, evidence collection, hearings, etc. It also closed its complaint and reporting window (Room 205). The resumption time would be announced separately. During this period, if one needed to make a complaint or report to the Hubei Provincial Public Resources Transaction Supervision and Administration Bureau, it was recommended to mail the complaint and report materials to the Bureau.

description:
On Feb 19th, 2020, the notice of health declaration certification service work (referred to as the "notice"), the notice clarifies that all residents who have lived in the Henan province for more than 14 days and are included in the grid management of the village (community) where they live, need to return to work across the county or return to work through the local transportation by the human resources and social security department should apply for a new health certificate. Others do it voluntarily. 
The health certificate can be applied through online appointments on the new COVID online service platform developed by the provincial health and health department.

description: From Feb 26, 2020, there will be restrictions for parks in Lanzhou, Gansu Province. Hygiene and sanitation measures are required, the number of people allowed to access and the opening hours are restricted. Visitors are required to keep a distance of 1 meter apart and wear masks. description:
On 15 March 2020, Xinjiang published guidelines for the operation of government departments and institutions. These include:

- Hygiene and sanitation measures of working spaces
- Health checks for employees
- Mask wearing for employees, cleaning staff, service personnel, security staff
- Promote online working and communication; a distance of 1 meter must be kept for essential face to face meetings
- Setting emergency areas for isolation and health monitoring
- Sanitation and restricted use of lifts, elevators and public restrooms.

The residential community for families of hospital workers has been closed. No one in the hospital or the community is allowed to enter or exit. Epidemiological tracking is being conducted for all visitors who came to the hospital since March 4.

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer Prefecture, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 prevention and control announces that all staff/members of the party/government institutions, including on-duty and retired, must be vaccinated by 25 July. Those with contraindications to the COVID-19 vaccine will be exempted. The vaccination must be regulated by the relevant managerial department or unit.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Bayannaoer Prefecture, Hangjinhou Banner; 13 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 prevention and control announces that starting from 15 July, in addition to continuing the current infection prevention and control measures and checking visitors' health code and travel history code: 

Proof of vaccination will be required when entering party/government organisations, libraries, and community service centres.

The venues are also required to register the details of those who are not vaccinated, recording information such as their name, ID number, occupation, residential address, phone number, etc. They should then immediately report to the industry's regulatory department. The department should report hereafter to the medical team of the local Command Centre for COVID-19 prevention and control.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Hinggan League, Horqin Right Middle Banner; 12 July 2021. The local Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several vaccination policies.

Starting from 15 July, In addition to the existing infection prevention and control measures and Health Code and Travel History Code check, proof of vaccination will also be required for using public transport/taxi services and visiting densely populated venues. The requirement applies to libraries, cultural centres, and museums.

The venue operators/drivers are also required to register unvaccinated patrons'/passengers' details, such as their name, ID number, residential address, and phone number, and immediately report to the industry's regulatory department. The department should report hereafter to the medical team of the local Command Centre.

description:
China, Shandong, August 9, 2021,Announcement on Epidemic Prevention and control of 5A Scenic spots in Shandong: 
1. Taishan Scenic Spot has implemented the real-name system for booking tickets, checking the health green code (which can be applied through "LOVE Shandong" APP, wechat or Alipay), epidemic prevention and control travel card (wechat follow "Gov.cn" public account -- epidemic service -- epidemic prevention and control travel card), safety inspection, temperature measurement and other systems. Please take the initiative to cooperate with the staff to do the temperature measurement, code check, security check, ticket check and other work. The indoor exhibition hall and other places in the scenic area have been suspended. 
2. In order to protect the health and safety of the public and tourists, and to do our best to prevent and control COVID-19, penglai Pavilion scenic Spot will be closed to the public from August 4 2021 and will be reopened at a later notice (please follow the public account of Penglai Pavilion on wechat at any time). 
3. Qufu Sankong Scenic Spot, Liugong Island Scenic spot, Longkou Nanshan Scenic Spot, Taierzhuang Ancient City also have enacted related restrictive policies to face the COVID situation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 August 2021. Inner Mongolia Culture and Tourism Department announces that:

Tourist attractions must set the limit of tourists, implement a ticket reservation system, and adopt scientific means to divert tourists effectively and control the tourist traffic. They must implement real-name registration and monitor tourist information regularly. Health screening must be carried out by implementing temperature checks and other methods. Social distancing must be observed in stations, ticket booths, scenic spots, rest areas, restaurants etc., to prevent gathering.

They must also arrange for tourists to enter at various periods. Places prone to congestion, such as the entrances and exits, scenic spots, narrow passages, etc., must be managed by staff. Routes must be optimised to avoid congestion. There should be additional staff for monitoring tourists at the scenic spots; uncivilised behaviours or those that do not meet epidemic prevention and control requirements must be addressed timely to maintain order.

Tourist attractions must strengthen the general public's knowledge of the epidemic to improve their awareness and cooperation with prevention and control measures. They should achieve this by releasing information regarding actions to be undertaken for re-opening and knowledge of epidemic prevention and control through, e.g., websites, WeChat public accounts, tourist service centres, signboards, broadcasts, and electronic displays.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 24, 2020, Henan Province issued a notice on the suspension of large public gathering activities. This includes.
First, from now on, the province suspended in a short period of time to gather a large number of large public gathering activities, including: concerts and other cultural performances; large-scale sports events; temple fairs and other folk activities; exhibitions, exhibitions, and talent recruitment; other large-scale group activities. In the original plan to hold the above activities in the near future, the organizers should immediately release information on the suspension or postponement of activities, and properly explain the work.
　　Second, the need to hold a small number of gatherings of outdoor festive entertainment activities, organizers must develop a detailed program of activities, in strict order to maintain, must be disinfection prevention, environmental cleanliness conditions, as far as possible to control the scale, compressed time, and in accordance with the relevant provisions of the public security organs to perform the approval process.
　　Third, the spontaneous organization of small-scale entertainment activities for the masses, does a good job of reasonable guidance, and effectively prevent and control the epidemic.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 31, 2020, Emergency Management Department of Hubei announced that all kinds of industrial, mining, and commercial enterprises in the province (except for those producing epidemic prevention and control materials) should reinforce the management of canteens, staff dormitories, elevator wells, and other gathering places. Until the end of the epidemic, these enterprises must not organize collective activities such as dinners or aggregated training.
Enterprises that did not fulfill requirments above must not resume work and production. Those in severe violations would be in the safety production "blacklist."

description: Most provinces have set start dates for schools as the epidemic ebbs with nearly zero domestic cases reported since March. According to the arrangements of the Ministry of Education, Shandong Province, combined with the actual situation of school's control work, and after the school’s research, it is scheduled to organize students to return to school in batches and staggered peaks from May 23, 2020. The specific return time and related requirements will be notified to each student by the school. Students who have not received the notification will not return to school temporarily.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

UPDATE: Most provinces have set start dates for schools as the epidemic ebbs with nearly zero domestic cases reported since March. According to the arrangements of the Ministry of Education, Shandong Province, combined with the actual situation of school's control work, and the school’s research, it is scheduled to organize students to return to school in batches and staggered peaks from May 23, 2020. The specific return time and related requirements will be notified to each student by the school. Students who have not received the notification will not return to school temporarily.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 30 December 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several measures required to be implemented during the New Year and Spring Festival. Restrictions on mass gatherings include reducing the scale of necessary activities, restricting the number of attendees, and strictly implementing prevention and control measures (e.g., nucleic acid testing, code-scanning, temperature check, mask-wearing, and disinfection). 

When organising/holding large-scale conferences, especially those including people from critical areas (i.e., overseas or other provinces), the organiser must assume the primary responsibility, reporting to the command centre for approval and strictly implementing preventive measures.

description: Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia advocated "non-necessary not to organize", and people should strictly simplify and reduce large-scale gathering activities from January 7, 2021. Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention recommended online meetings, such as video conferencing. description:
Notice of the Market Management Department of the Ministry of Culture and Tourism on Further Strengthening the Normalization of Epidemic Prevention and Control in Theaters and Other Performance Places, Internet Service Places, and Entertainment Places:

(1) In low-risk areas of the epidemic, there will no longer be uniform restrictions on the proportion of consumers receiving theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues. The party committees and governments of each province (region, city) will control themselves according to the local epidemic prevention and control situation.

(2) To hold large-scale commercial performances, it is necessary to strengthen communication and coordination with public security and other departments, and appropriately control the number of people in accordance with local epidemic prevention and control requirements.

(3) Suspend the new approval of foreign-related, Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan-related commercial performance activities (except for those with cast members already in China)

(4) If a local epidemic occurs in the area, it is recommended to strictly control or suspend performances according to the specific situation.

For more details please check the 
URL:http://www.gov.cn/zhengce/zhengceku/2021-03/15/content_5593039.htm
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Notice of Department of Market Management, Ministry of Culture and Tourism on 12th March: 
All public places(just low-risk areas) have actively promoted the orderly restoration of theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues and without any restriction of people capacity. However, there are a few tips and restrictions for this policy.
(1) In low-risk areas of the epidemic, there will no longer be uniform restrictions on the proportion of consumers receiving theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues. The party committees and governments of each province (region, city) will control themselves according to the local epidemic prevention and control situation.
(2) Holding large-scale commercial performances, it is necessary to strengthen communication and coordination with public security and other departments, and appropriately control the number of people in accordance with local epidemic prevention and control requirements.
(3) Suspend the new approval of foreign-related, Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan-related commercial performance activities (except for those with cast members already in China).
(4) If a local epidemic occurs in an area, it is recommended to strictly control or suspend performances according to the specific situation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
China, Inner Mongolia, Ulanqab; 6 August 2021. Ulanqab Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces that:

4. Gathering events will be strictly controlled. All large-scale conferences and activities must adhere to the principle of "do not hold unless necessary, and whoever holds it will take the accountability". If a gathering event is necessary to be held, it must be approved by the responsible department and reported to the local command centre. The local government must assume the responsibility; the event organiser must be accountable for implementing the required epidemic prevention and control measures;  Banquets, such as those for weddings, housewarmings, birthdays, and school enrollment, must be postponed. Funeral ceremonies must be simplified and prohibit people returning from epidemic areas from attending. The general public is advised not to attend banquets and gatherings. All private family gatherings, dinners, etc., must be limited to less than 10 people, and public officials should take the lead in implementing the above measures.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 August 2021. Inner Mongolia Culture and Tourism Department announces that:

All venues must follow the relevant guideline for re-opening and promoting the recovery of cultural markets. Coordinating with public security and other relevant departments is required when organising large-scale performances; a capacity limit must be maintained according to the local requirements. All new commercial performances and those involving performers from overseas, Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan must be suspended (performers already in the region are exempted). If there is an outbreak within the region, events will be regulated or suspended accordingly. 

All regions must ensure that the enterprises assume the responsibility, urging them to implement epidemic prevention and control measures at the venues and consumer and employee protection measures. Strengthened measures must be in place in rural markets and high-risk areas, as well as during holidays and high-risk periods.

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered the Housing and Construction Departments of all levels to strengthen the safety protection of environmental sanitation operators and front-line law enforcement team members. All front-line personnel must take safe and effective protective measures during the epidemic prevention and control period. All units must distribute masks, gloves, and other protective equipment in full to prevent infection of workers. The departments must organize training and guidance for sanitation and cleaning personnel, teach them correct protection methods, and prevent cross-infection due to lack of protection. The departments must reasonably arrange work and rest, scientifically control labor intensity, and prevent problems such as excessive fatigue.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to strengthen the self-protection of staff. The staff must wear work clothes and masks, wash hands frequently, and develop good hygiene during work. They must wash and disinfect their hands before serving and feeding children. When the staff accompany children to the hospital, they must take various protective measures. During the work period, the institutions must check on all staff regularly. If they had fever, cough and other suspected symptoms, the institutions must put them under quarantine, send them to medical treatment in time, and report relevant information.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered funeral homes to strengthen the protective measures for funeral workers. They should equip funeral service personnel with masks, disinfectants, thermometers and other necessary protective equipment, and staff who came into contact with the remains of patients with new pneumonia (including suspected patients) should implement the most stringent protective measures. They should reinforce the epidemic prevention and control of key areas such as the business halls, service negotiation rooms, and ash collection areas, set up special reception desks, allow no more than 2 family members to handle the business at a time, and adopt methods such as wearing masks, measuring body temperature, washing and disinfecting hands, reinforcing the safety and protection of front-line workers. The funeral homes must strictly disinfect all workplaces and ventilate facilities to eliminate all hidden dangers that may spread the virus.

The department also prohibited all real estate agencies from holding large-scale activities. The department also urged the relevant personnel of real estate companies and agencies to wear protective equipment such as masks and to do their own protection and disinfection.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Provincial Welfare Lottery Center, the City and State Management Station, and the Zhongfu Sales Agencies with Online Agreements to postpone the opening of the welfare lottery market. After the resumption of the market, they must implement the epidemic prevention and control requirements for business sites strictly. They must open windows regularly for ventilation, regular cleaning, and disinfection of welfare lottery sales agencies and various operations, maintaining environmental sanitation. Before the epidemic ended, staff and sales personnel should wear masks and other protective equipment to work. Lottery ticket buyers entering sales agencies or operations should wear masks as requested.

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to comply with the Ministry of Civil Affairs’ “Guidelines for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Outbreak of Elderly Care Institutions,’’ formulate an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strengthen the primary responsibility of the institution directors, strengthen personnel investigation, and monitor their epidemic cases. The institutions should put cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus into quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, while reporting and assisting in investigations. Institutional staff must strictly implement disinfection, temperature measurement, and other preventive controls.
The institutions should emphasize mental adaptability of the elderly and staff to relieve anxiety and fear, pay close attention to the physical conditions of the elderly every day in time, measure the body temperature of the staff twice a day, regularly open windows for ventilation, regularly implement disinfection to maintain environmental hygiene within the institutions, and carry out knowledge education on epidemic prevention and control for staff and elderly residents in institutions.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities,Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to implement temporary closed management. During the temporary closed management period, they must cancel all elderly outings and family visits; the elderly who had taken leave and left could return to the hospital after inspection and evaluation after the epidemic ended; they should not take in new elderly. Except for personnel providing work security, medical security, logistical security, and prevention and control guidance, other unrelated personnel might not enter. Elderly residents might not leave without authorization. For elderly persons who really need to go out for medical reasons, the staff shall help them take protective measures.
The institutions should cancel gathering activities and dining. They should guide the elderly to stay in their own rooms as much as possible, or organize outdoor activities in batches. They should encourage relatives and children to use WeChat, video calls, and phone calls to express greetings to the elderly.
Other organizations with elderly care should conduct closed management as an elderly care institution.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities,Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry),Other population not specifed above

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all home-based elderly care service organizations in the province to suspend home-visit service and temporary close all street day care centers for the elderly, home-based service centers for the elderly in urban and rural communities, meal stations for the elderly, and other service facilities. For the disabled (dementia) elderly at home, if there was a real need for home-visit nursing services, the visiting personnel shall conduct home services after the dispatched agency assessed their health and improved relevant protective measures, and shall clean and disinfect the elderly’s homes.

description: China, Guangdong province will enforce closed management to each residential area (using each residential development as the unit) starting on Feb 14, 2020. Limited access to all visitors' entry to the residential area except deliveries. All entry points will be guarded by a gateman 24 hours and each entry point will be equipped with at least one Infrared thermometer. In case of the absence of the gateman or detected body temperature exceeding 37.3 C, no entry will be allowed.

description:
On Feb 19th, 2020, the Henan Provincial People's Government issued the new crown pneumonia epidemic for enterprises to resume work and production for Luoyang city. The requirement includes:
1. Establish a mechanism (e.g. develop a prevention and control plan)
2. health monitoring of all employees, set up temporary isolation points; employees who have a history of living in other areas with severe epidemics and who have had a history of close contact with confirmed or suspected cases will be subject to centralized isolation or home medical observation for 14 days
3. Preparation for COVID protection (sanitization, Keeping windows open for 30 minutes at least twice a day in the workplace, etc)

description: From Feb 26, 2020, there will be restrictions for parks in Lanzhou, Gansu Province. Hygiene and sanitation measures are required, the number of people allowed to access and the opening hours are restricted. Visitors are required to keep a distance of 1 meter apart and wear masks. There will also be some facilities within parks that are temporarily closed. These parks include Wuquanshan Park, Yantan Park, Xiaoxihu Park and Baitashan Park.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 3, 2020, the Transportation Department of Liaoning Province announced 30 Items for port and ship companies in Liaoning to prevent and control the epidemic. As for port companies, ships operating at ports in severely epidemic areas abroad are limited with some conditions. For the ships, the crew members on ship are not allowed to change or disembark unless there are special circumstances. For the boarding operators on land, their number should be strictly restricted, they should keep a safe distance from the crew and not enter the crew’s living area and they should obey the rules of health testing, health monitoring, and wearing protective equipment, including masks, gloves, protective clothing and goggles.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Transportation (land; water and air)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: People with certain health conditions (please note which health conditions in the text entry),Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description: On March 3, 2020, the Transportation Department of Liaoning Province announced 30 Items for port and ship companies in Liaoning to prevent and control the epidemic. As for ship companies, their crew members should be under health monitoring by the company and they are not allowed to go ashore when the ship is boarding at ports in severely epidemic areas overseas. Operators and port passenger terminals of waterway passenger transport routes from Liaoning province to severely epidemic areas overseas are suspended to carry out international passenger transport services, and ship companies should apply to the Department of Pandemic Prevention and Control of Liaoning Province 24 hours before reopening the services for unlocks.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 15 2020, Xinjiang published guidelines for the management measures of shopping malls and supermarkets. These include:

- Hygiene and cleaning measures
- Setting key areas for health checking, waste management, emergency isolation
- Temperature checks for all staff and customers
- Mask wearing for staff and customers
- Social distancing and restricting contact on elevators and in lifts.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the following: 

1(b) Staggered start for other grades of junior and senior high schools, secondary vocational schools, primary schools, kindergartens, and special education schools. 

1(c) Colleges and universities to resume classes in accordance with the unified arrangements of the Ministry of Education;

1(d) Schools will be notified in phases by the autonomous region of the start date for each grade. Arranging for re-opening without receiving notice remains prohibited. All educational administrative departments and institutions of higher learning to provide official written reports to the education department a week before the re-opening regarding their arrangements.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 March 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces the following: 

1(b) Staggered start for other grades of junior and senior high schools, secondary vocational schools, primary schools, kindergartens, and special education schools. 
1(c) Colleges and universities to resume classes in accordance with the unified arrangements of the Ministry of Education;

description:
Starting May 07, 2020, the Chinese national government released new guidelines for the reopening of primary and secondary schools: 

1) Document all returning staff and student and check temperature at school entrance. 
2) Must conduct 14 days of self-quarantine before returning 
3) Daily health monitoring during morning and nights. Must report data daily to local government 
4) Health monitoring/reporting of families of staff and students 
5) Surveillance of health risks on campus. Daily sterilization of public areas, hand-washing and drinking services, and trash collection.
6) Control population density on campus, maintain social distancing protocols. Different school start times, lunch times, and end times should vary to prevent mass gatherings.
7) Restriction on all mass gatherings such as conferences, meetings. 
8) Strengthen COVID-19 education for returning students and staff
9) Encourage collaboration and communication with parents. 
10) Open psychological counseling, mental health related services, hotlines. 
11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jiangsu Province requires full-coverage nucleic acid testing for staff in elderly care institutions starting June 19, 2020. People who have been to high epidemic risk areas are prohibited from accessing nursing homes. Elderly people who return to the nursing home or newly admitted must have nucleic acid testing or provide a nucleic acid test-related certification report before they are accessed to the institution. Visits will continue to strictly follow the principle of "no appointments no visits, visits after health assessments" to block the epidemic in elderly care institutions.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Public transport services across Xinjiang have been gradually and orderly resumed starting August 29 2020. The bus load rate shall not exceed 50%, the front row of the taxi shall not carry passengers, and the back row shall not exceed 2 people in principle. Passengers are required to wear masks throughout the ride. Xinjiang's internal air routes and railway lines have been gradually opened, passengers are required to carry a negative nucleic acid report within seven days.

The bus load rate shall not exceed 50%, the front row of the taxi shall not carry passengers, and the back row shall not exceed 2 people in principle. Xinjiang's internal air routes and railway lines have been gradually opened, passengers are required to carry a negative nucleic acid report within seven days.

description: China, Inner Mongolia; 30 December 2020. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces several measures required to be implemented during the New Year and Spring Festival. Measures target retail businesses (e.g., shopping malls, supermarkets, farmers' markets, wholesale markets, cinemas, theatres, Internet cafes, bars, restaurants, hotels), airports, railway, and subway stations. These venues should reinforce policies and measures such as crowd control, temperature checks at entry, mask-wearing, checking of "health code", and disinfection in public areas.

description: On January 22nd, 2021, Hebei, China published a guide for COVID-19 prevention and control at construction sites. The "Guide" requires that an epidemic prevention and control organization be established by the project leader at the construction site, equipped with adequate medical protective masks, protective clothing, goggles, disposable gloves, disinfectant alcohol, and disinfectant that meet national and industry standards. , Anti-epidemic materials such as intelligent body temperature detection equipment, and reliable supply channels. Real-name management is implemented for the entry personnel. The entry personnel must hold a health code and have a negative nucleic acid test before entering the construction site. After entering the construction site, the nucleic acid test should be performed in a timely manner according to the situation. All management personnel and migrant workers who enter the construction area, office area, and living area, including service personnel such as security guards, cleaning, canteens, etc., must wear masks, and the changed masks must be properly handled. Except for procurement personnel, material supply vehicles and personnel (the two categories of personnel should also check the health code and temperature measurement registration), all other personnel are not allowed to enter the site, and personnel at the entrance and exit shall be on duty 24 hours a day.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 28, the Henan Provincial Culture and Tourism Department announced specific guidelines for the tourism market on epidemics prevention and control during the Spring Festival of 2021. 
In principle, no large-scale events should be held during the Spring Festival period. Otherwise, it must be strictly approved based on careful evaluation. The number of audiences in theatres and other performance venues shall not exceed 75% of the theatre's seating capacity. For venues containing multiple theatre rooms, measures shall be implemented so the audiences can enter and exit through different routes and times to avoid large-scale gatherings. For all types of entertainment venues, the number of customers allowed for entrance shall not exceed 75% of the regular allowance. 
For travel agencies, safety risk assessments on tourism routes must be carefully conducted. It is strictly forbidden to organize travel to medium- and high-risk areas. Local administrative departments should urge travel agencies to implement the "one group, one report" system -- filling in travel information and uploading the electronic contracts on the national tourism supervision service platform for inspection. 
Star-rated should implement the epidemic prevention and control measures such as regular nucleic acid testing on imported cold-chain food and workers, disinfecting public supplies and appliances and widening the distance between tables.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 22 January 2021. Inner Mongolia Command Centre for COVID-19 Prevention and Control announces measures to prevent and control the epidemic during Spring Festival:

3. All party/government organisations and enterprises should not hold large-scale gatherings/conferences and instead organise online meetings. If having a conference with more than 50 people, the host should formulate and implement a prevention and control plan under the guidance of the local Command Centre. They should also cancel group worship and condolences, gatherings, dinners, training etc.

6. Retail pharmacies must implement the real-name registration when selling antipyretic, antitussive, antiviral, antibiotics and other drugs. If a patient is experiencing fever or cough symptoms, they should report to the local community health centre within 2 hours.

8. The total visitor capacity of all tourist attractions, theatres, Internet cafes, and singing and dancing entertainment venues shall not exceed 75%. The number of people in closed places such as bathrooms and bathhouses should not be over 50% of the capacity limit.

9. For shopping malls, supermarkets, catering venues and accommodation, farmers' markets, cultural and entertainment venues, and public transport (airports, railway stations, subways, and bus stations), measures such as crowd control, ventilation, disinfection and sanitation, temperature checks, mask-wearing, and checking of the "health code" must be reinforced.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
China, Shandong, August 9, 2021,Announcement on Epidemic Prevention and control of 5A Scenic spots in Shandong: 
1. Taishan Scenic Spot has implemented the real-name system for booking tickets, checking the health green code (which can be applied through "LOVE Shandong" APP, wechat or Alipay), epidemic prevention and control travel card (wechat follow "Gov.cn" public account -- epidemic service -- epidemic prevention and control travel card), safety inspection, temperature measurement and other systems. Please take the initiative to cooperate with the staff to do the temperature measurement, code check, security check, ticket check and other work. The indoor exhibition hall and other places in the scenic area have been suspended. 
2. In order to protect the health and safety of the public and tourists, and to do our best to prevent and control COVID-19, penglai Pavilion scenic Spot will be closed to the public from August 4 2021 and will be reopened at a later notice (please follow the public account of Penglai Pavilion on wechat at any time). 
3. Qufu Sankong Scenic Spot, Liugong Island Scenic spot, Longkou Nanshan Scenic Spot, Taierzhuang Ancient City also have enacted related restrictive policies to face the COVID situation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Parks
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Since 10:00 on August 13, 2021, the entire area of Xiamen is a low-risk area. Long-distance bus stations resume normal operations. Passengers must carry ID cards, wear masks, present health codes and pass the temperature test before entering the station to board the train. One meter interval queues must be maintained to prevent gathering when entering the station to ride or purchase tickets. Passenger vehicles will be implemented each trip to carry passengers before the car ventilation cleaning and disinfection, please wear a mask throughout the passenger.

description:
China, Inner Mongolia; 21 August 2021. Inner Mongolia Culture and Tourism Department announces that:

Tourist attractions must set the limit of tourists, implement a ticket reservation system, and adopt scientific means to divert tourists effectively and control the tourist traffic. They must implement real-name registration and monitor tourist information regularly. Health screening must be carried out by implementing temperature checks and other methods. Social distancing must be observed in stations, ticket booths, scenic spots, rest areas, restaurants etc., to prevent gathering.

They must also arrange for tourists to enter at various periods. Places prone to congestion, such as the entrances and exits, scenic spots, narrow passages, etc., must be managed by staff. Routes must be optimised to avoid congestion. There should be additional staff for monitoring tourists at the scenic spots; uncivilised behaviours or those that do not meet epidemic prevention and control requirements must be addressed timely to maintain order.

Tourist attractions must strengthen the general public's knowledge of the epidemic to improve their awareness and cooperation with prevention and control measures. They should achieve this by releasing information regarding actions to be undertaken for re-opening and knowledge of epidemic prevention and control through, e.g., websites, WeChat public accounts, tourist service centres, signboards, broadcasts, and electronic displays.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Tourist Sites
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On August 20, 2021 Liaoning Province announced the start date for schools in Liaoning of Fall 2021 semester. The province’s primary and secondary schools, secondary vocational schools, and kindergartens will start the fall semester according to the original planned date; colleges and universities will first organize online teaching according to the original planned start date. Starting from September 4, 2021, organize students (including freshmen) in phases and batches, at wrong times and peaks back to school one after another.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
